lines.value: american sign language old names amslan ameslan ) is the most popular sign language for the deaf in the united states in the english speaking parts of canada and in parts of mexico
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although the united kingdom and the united states share english as a spoken and written language british sign language bsl is different from american sign language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: asl actually comes from french sign language as thomas hopkins gallaudet went to england for help learning sign language to teach to his deaf neighbors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he could not find anyone willing to teach him the british sign language but did find some french people who were willing to help he convinced one of them to travel back to the united states with him to set up the first deaf school in the us asl is also used sometimes with other sign languages in the philippines singapore dominican republic haiti puerto rico cote d'ivoire burkina faso ghana togo benin nigeria chad gabon democratic republic of the congo central african republic mauritania kenya madagascar and zimbabwe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like other sign languages its grammar is different from any spoken language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: asl includes fingerspelling
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fingerspelling is a way to show the written letter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: asl uses one hand to show the english alphabet although there are ways to show alphabets from other languages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: names of people and names of places can be fingerspelled
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fingerspelling is also used for words that have no sign or for when people are confused about what a used sign means
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: counting the number of asl speakers is difficult because asl users have never been counted by the american census
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: asl use in the general american population has not been directly measured
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ultimate source for current estimates of the number of asl users in the united states is a report for the national census of the deaf population ncdp by schein and delk 1974
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: based on a 1972 survey of the ncdp schein and delk provided estimates consistent with a signing population between 250000 and 500000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the survey did not distinguish between asl and other forms of signing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: incorrect figures are sometimes cited for the population of asl speakers in the united states based on misunderstandings of statistics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: demographics of the deaf population have been confused with those of asl use
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this accounts for cited estimations which are greater than 500000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: such mistaken estimations can reach as high as 15000000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: asl is sometimes incorrectly cited as the third or fourth most spoken language in the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these figures misquote schein and delk 1974 who said asl speakers constituted the third largest population requiring an interpreter in court
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however major parts of the city have been destroyed and rebuilt because of many wars and of earthquakes in the mid 19th century

lines.value: in recent decades the city has been known as a university town with the university of perugia about 34000 students the university for foreigners 5000 students and some smaller colleges also

lines.value: there are annual festivals and events the eurochocolate festival october the umbria jazz festival and the international journalism festival in april
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: perugia is a well known artistic center of italy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the famous painter pietro vannucci nicknamed perugino came from citta della pieve near perugia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he decorated the local sala del cambio with a beautiful series of frescoes eight of his pictures can also be seen in the national gallery of umbria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: perugino was the teacher of raphael the great renaissance artist who produced five paintings in perugia today no longer in the city the precise role of raphael in perugino's works executed during his apprenticeship is disputed by scholars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the independent works depicted in perugia are the ansidei madonna taken by the french under the terms of the treaty of tolentino in 1798 the deposition by raphael pala baglioni this masterpiece was expropriated by scipione borghese in 1608 cf

lines.value: the guardian october 19 2004 the madonna and child enthroned with saints by raphael formerly in the convent of st anthony of padua cf
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the colonna altarpiece review at art history the connestabile madonna this picture left perugia in 1871 when count connestabile sold it to the emperor of russia for £13200 cf
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: encyclopaedia britannica the oddi altar by raphael requisitioned by the french in 1798 and one fresco

lines.value: another famous painter pinturicchio lived in perugia

lines.value: the city symbol is the griffin which can be seen in the form of plaques and statues on buildings around the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: perugia was an umbrian settlement but first appears in written history as perusia one of the twelve confederate cities of etruria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was first mentioned in q fabius pictor's account used by livy of the expedition carried out against the etruscans by fabius maximus rullianus in 310 or 309 bc at that time a thirty year indutiae truce was agreed upon however in 295 bc perusia took part in the third samnite war and was reduced with volsinii and arretium arezzo to seek for peace in the following year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 216 and 205 bc perugia assisted rome in the second punic war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: little else is known until 41-40 bc when lucius antonius brother of mark antony took refuge there in the roman civil war between mark antony and octavian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: much of ancient perugia was destroyed by octavian later became emperor augustus after a long siege and its senators were sent to their death
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a number of lead bullets used by slingers have been found in and around the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city was burnt we are told with the exception of the temples of vulcan and juno
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the huge etruscan terrace walls naturally can hardly have suffered at all
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: afterward the town with the territory for a mile round was allowed to be occupied by whoever came
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it must have been rebuilt almost at once for several bases of statues exist inscribed with the words augusto sacr(um perusia restituta
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the town did not become a colonia until 251-253 ad when it was resettled as colonia vibia augusta perusia under the emperor c vibius trebonianus gallus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: perugia is hardly mentioned except by the geographers until it was the only city in umbria to resist totila who captured it and laid the city waste in 547 after a long siege apparently after the city's byzantine garrison evacuated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: negotiations with the besieging forces fell to the city's bishop herculanus as representative of the townspeople
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: totila is said to have ordered the bishop to be flayed and beheaded
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: st herculanus sant'ercolano later became the city's patron saint
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the lombard period perugia is spoken of as one of the principal cities of tuscia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 9th century with the consent of charlemagne and louis the pious it passed under the popes but by the 11th century its commune was asserting itself and for many centuries the city continued to maintain an independent life warring against many of the neighbouring lands and cities foligno assisi spoleto todi siena arezzo etc in 1186 henry vi holy roman emperor rex romanorum and future emperor granted diplomatic recognition to the consular government of the city afterward pope innocent iii whose major aim was to give state dignity to the dominions having been constituting the patrimony of st peter acknowledged the validity of the imperial statement and recognized the established civic practices having the force of law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on various occasions the popes found asylum from the conflicts in rome within its walls and it was the meeting place of five conclaves perugia papacy including those which elected honorius iii 1216 clement iv 1285 celestine v 1294 and clement v 1305 the papal presence was characterized by a peace time rule between the internal rivalries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but perugia had no mind simply to serve the papal interests and never accepted papal sovereignty the city used to exercise a jurisdiction over the members of the clergy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also in 1282 perugia was excommunicated due to a new military conflict against the ghibellines regardless of a papal prohibition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the other hand side by side with the 13th-century bronze griffin of perugia above the door of the palazzo dei priori stands as a guelphic emblem the lion perugia remained loyal for the most part to the guelph party in the struggles of guelphs and ghibellines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however this dominant tendency was rather an anti germanic and italian political strategy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the angevin presence in italy appeared offer a counterpoise to papal powers in 1319 perugia declared the angevin saint louis of toulouse protector of the city's sovereignty and of the palazzo of its priors and set his figure among the other patron saints above the rich doorway of the palazzo dei priori
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the half of the 14th century bartholus of sassoferrato who was a renowned jurist asserted that perugia was dependent upon neither imperial nor papal support
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1347 at the time of rienzi's unfortunate enterprise in reviving the roman republic perugia sent ten ambassadors to pay him honour and when papal messengers sought to force it by foreign soldiers or to exact contributions they met with vigorous resistance which broke into open warfare with pope urban v in 1369 in 1370 the noble party reached an agreement signing the treaty of bologna and perugia was forced to accept a papal legate however the vicar general of the papal states gerard du puy abbot of marmoutier and nephew of pope gregory ix was expelled by a popular uprising in 1375 and his fortification of porta sole was razed to the ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: civic peace was constantly disturbed in the 14th century by struggles between the party representing the people raspanti and the nobles beccherini
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the assassination in 1398 of biordo michelotti who had made himself lord of perugia the city became a pawn in the italian wars passing to gian galeazzo visconti 1400 to pope boniface ix 1403 and to ladislas of naples 1408-14 before it settled into a period of sound governance under the signoria of the condottiero braccio da montone 1416-24 who reached a concordance with the papacy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: following mutual atrocities of the oddi and the baglioni families power was at last concentrated in the baglioni who though they had no legal position defied all other authority though their bloody internal squabbles culminated in a massacre 14 july 1500
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gian paolo baglioni was lured to rome in 1520 and beheaded by leo x and in 1540 rodolfo who had slain a papal legate was defeated by pier luigi farnese and the city captured and plundered by his soldiery was deprived of its privileges
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a citadel known as the rocca paolina after the name of pope paul iii italian paolo was built to the designs of antonio da sangallo the younger ad coercendam perusinorum audaciam in 1797 the city was conquered by french troops
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 4 february 1798 the tiberina republic was formed with perugia as the capital and the french tricolour as flag
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1799 the tiberina republic merged to the roman republic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1832 1838 and 1854 perugia was hit by earthquakes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: following the collapse of the roman republic of 1848-49 when the rocca was in part demolished it was seized in may 1849 by the austrians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in june 1859 the people rebelled against the temporal authority of the pope and established a provisional government but the insurrection was quashed bloodily by pius ix's troops
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in september 1860 the city was united finally along with the rest of umbria as part of the kingdom of italy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: perugia is the capital city of the region of umbria

lines.value: jean cauvin also jean calvin john calvin in english july 10 1509 - may 27 1564 was a french protestant theologian during the protestant reformation and was a central developer of the system of christian theology called calvinism or reformed theology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in geneva he rejected papal authority established a new scheme of and ecclesiastical governance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is famous for his teachings and writings and infamous for his role in the execution of michael servetus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calvin was born with the name jean chauvin or cauvin in latin calvinus in noyon picardie france to gerard cauvin and jeanne lefranc
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1523 calvin's father a lawyer sent his fourteen year old son to the university of paris to study humanities and law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by 1532 he had attained a doctor of law degree at orleans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1536 he settled in geneva switzerland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after being expelled from the city he served as a pastor in strasbourg from 1538 until 1541 before returning to geneva where he lived until his death in 1564
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calvin was trained to be a lawyer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he studied under some of the best legal minds of the renaissance in france
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: part of that training involved the newer humanistic methods of trying to understand which dealt with a text directly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his training was important for calvin because once convinced of evangelicalism he applied these methods to the bible
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he molded his thinking along biblical lines and he labored to preach and teach what he believed the bible taught
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while reformers such as jan hus and martin luther may be seen as somewhat original thinkers that began a movement calvin was a great logician and systematizer of that movement but not an innovator in doctrine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calvin was very familiar with the writings of the early church fathers and the great medieval schoolmen and he was also in debt to earlier reformers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calvin did not reject the scholastics of the middle ages outright but rather made use of them and reformed their thoughts in accordance with his understanding of the bible
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calvin is often associated with the doctrines of predestination and election but he said pretty much the same things that the other magisterial reformers said about these doctrines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calvin's power was very great in his last years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was known all around the world as a reformer different from martin luther
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mainly luther and calvin respected each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however luther and a zurich reformer huldrych zwingli thought differently about the eucharist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calvin's thoughts about it made luther believe that calvin agreed with zwingli
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the same time calvin was sad that the reformers were not all together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he tried to join them together by signing the consensus tigurinus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was an agreement between the zurich and geneva churches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calvin's greatest help to the english speaking people was by giving marian exiles in geneva protection
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he did this starting in 1555
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with the city's protection they could make their own reformed church under john knox and william whittingham
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they later carried many of calvin's ideas back to england and scotland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however calvin was most interested in trying to change his homeland france
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he helped the building of churches by giving out literature and offering ministers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between 1555 and 1562 over one hundred ministers were sent to france
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: inside geneva calvin mainly wanted to make a college a school for children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a place to build the school was picked on 25 march 1558
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was opened the next year on 5 june 1559
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was divided into two parts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one part was a grammar school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the grammar school was called the college or schola privata
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the other part was an school called the academie or schola publica
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in five years there were 1200 students in the grammar school and 300 in the advanced school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the college later became the college calvin one of the college preparatory schools of geneva
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the academie became the university of geneva
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in autumn 1558 calvin became ill with a fever
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was afraid he might die before finishing his last revision of the institutes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this he forced himself to work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the last edition became much longer so calvin called it a new work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was 21 chapters in the edition before the last one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however in the last one it was 80
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was because of more detail in the material that was already there more subjects were not really added

lines.value: the code of hammurabi was a legal code of babylonia written about 1700 bc it was written on a stele a large stone monument and put in a public place where everyone could see it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the stele was later captured by the elamites and taken to their capital susa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was found there again in 1901 and is now in the louvre museum in paris
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the code of hammurabi had 282 laws written by scribes on 12 tablets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike earlier laws it was written in akkadian the daily language of babylonia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the code of hammurabi is the longest surviving text from the old babylonian period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the code is an early example of a law regulating a government a kind of primitive constitution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the code is also one of the earliest examples of the presumption of innocence innocent until proven otherwise
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it suggests that both the accused and accuser have the opportunity to provide evidence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the code of hammurabi was one of several sets of laws in the ancient near east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the code of laws was arranged in groups so that everyone who read the laws would know what was required of them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were earlier laws and later laws such as the law of moses in the hebrew bible
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these codes come from cultures in a relatively small geographical area and they have passages which resemble each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nearly half the code deals with contracts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it sets the wages to be paid to an ox driver or a surgeon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other passages set the liability of a builder for a house that collapses for example or property that is damaged while left in the care of another
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a third of the code concerns household and family matters such as inheritance divorce paternity and sexual behaviour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for each crime a specific punishment is listed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the punishments tended to be harsh by modern standards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they included death cutting off a body part and the use of the eye for eye tooth for tooth philosophy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the penalties of his laws may seem cruel to modern readers but the fact that he put into writing the laws of his kingdom is considered an important step forward in the development of civilization
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the code of hammurabi was one of many sets of laws in the ancient near east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in anatomy the term ligament usually means fibrous tissue that connects bones to other bones or cartilages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this use a ligament is a short band of tough fibrous connective tissue composed mainly of long stringy collagen fibres
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ligaments connect bones to other bones to form a joint
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they do not connect muscles to bones that is the function of tendons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some ligaments limit the mobility of articulations or prevent certain movements altogether
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ligaments are only slightly elastic when under tension they gradually lengthen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is one reason why dislocated joints must be set as quickly as possible if the ligaments lengthen too much then the joint will be weakened
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: athletes gymnasts dancers and martial artists perform stretching exercises to lengthen their ligaments making their joints more supple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the consequence of a broken ligament can be instability of the joint
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: not all broken ligaments need surgery but if surgery is needed to stabilise the joint the broken ligament can be joined
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: air is the earth's atmosphere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: air around us is a mixture of many gases and dust particles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the clear gas in which living things live and breathe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has an indefinite shape and volume
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has no colour or smell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has mass and weight because it is matter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the weight of air creates atmospheric pressure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is no air in outer space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: air is a mixture of about 78% nitrogen 21% oxygen 0.9% argon 0.04% carbon dioxide and very small amounts of other gases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is an average of about 1% water vapour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: animals live by aerobic respiration and need to breathe the oxygen in the air
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in breathing the lungs put oxygen into the blood and send back carbon dioxide to the air
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: plants need the carbon dioxide in the air to live
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they give off the oxygen that we breathe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: without it we die of asphyxia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: wind is moving air
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this causes weather
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: air can be polluted by some gases such as carbon monoxide smoke and ash
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this air pollution causes various problems including smog acid rain and global warming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aircraft use propellers to move air over a wing which allows them to fly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pneumatics use air pressure to move things

lines.value: egypt is a country in northeast africa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its capital city is cairo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: egypt is famous for its ancient monuments such as the pyramids and the sphinx
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ancient egypt has one of the longest histories of any country in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a province of the roman empire it became christian and some coptic church people are still there after more than a thousand years of muslim rule
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fatimid caliphate ruled egypt in the tenth through twelfth centuries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mamlukes ruled it until 1798 when napoleon defeated them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: muhammad ali pasha soon took over and started a dynasty of khedives under the ottoman empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the empire fell apart after world war i egypt became an independent country in 1922 and the khedive became a king
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: egypt is a member of the united nations and the arab league
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it became a republic after the army's revolution of 1952
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: egypt is a large country but a large portion of it is desert
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most people 95% of egypt's total people live in areas around the coast of the mediterranean sea and along the nile river
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes the cities of cairo alexandria aswan and port said
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: not many people live in the desert
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today egypt has about 90 million people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: egypt is divided into 29 areas called governorates of egypt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: egypt is a country which has had many different rulers and many political systems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after world war ii egypt was still ruled by a king farouk of egypt 11 february 1920 - 18 march 1965
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the last ruler of the muhammad ali dynasty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: farouk was overthrown on 23 july 1952 by a military coup
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the coup was led by muhammad naguib and gamal abdel nasser
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from then on egypt had military rulers or rulers who had the backing of the army and many citizens
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nasser became president from 1956 to 1970
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later rulers were anwar sadat and hosni mubarak
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in january 2011 thousands of protesters gathered in cairo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they wanted hosni mubarak to leave office
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had been the president for almost 30 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on february 11 2011 vice president omar suleiman made an announcement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said that mubarak agreed to leave office
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2012 egypt had a democratic election for the post of president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the winner was the muslim brotherhood candidate mohamed morsi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the events which followed are still controversial but one aspect stands out
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: morsi issued a declaration that in effect gave him unlimited powers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had the power to legislate make laws without legal overview by the courts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this caused widespread protests
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 3 july 2013 he was unseated by a military coup council a coup d'etat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after an election in june 2014 abdel fattah el sisi became president of egypt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: islamist movements such as the muslim brotherhood rejected the change of regime as a military coup and not democratic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today the people of egypt are mostly sunni muslims

lines.value: there are still many christians in egypt today

lines.value: many of these belong to the coptic orthodox church of alexandria

lines.value: english

lines.value: french and german are also taught in egypt as second language

lines.value: many famous people are from egypt

lines.value: some of these include omar sharif who was an international actor boutros boutros ghali who was the first person from africa to lead the united nations and four nobel prize winners anwar sadat who won the nobel peace prize in 1978 naguib mahfouz who won the nobel prize in literature in 1988 ahmed zewail who won the nobel prize in chemistry in 1999 and mohamed elbaradei who won the nobel peace prize in 2005

lines.value: euro is the currency money of the countries in the eurozone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one euro is divided into 100 cent officially singular or cents unofficially
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of the number of different languages in the european union there are different unofficial names for this unit the french call them centimes and the spanish centimos for example
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was created in 1999 but until 1 january 2002 it was used only for electronic payments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2002 12 countries of the european union eu got rid of their national currencies completely and adopted euro notes and coins as their only money
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was a change over period called the transition period when both the old national money and the euro were accepted but by 28 february 2002 all 12 countries were using just euros
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2007 slovenia became the 13th country to use the euro
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2008 cyprus and malta became the 14th and 15th countries to use the euro
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2009 slovakia became the 16th country to use the euro
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2011 estonia became the 17th country to use the euro
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2014 latvia became the 18th country and in 2015 lithuania became the 19th country to use the euro
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are seven different banknotes each one with a different colour size and face value €5 grey €10 red €20 blue €50 orange €100 green €200 yellow €500 purple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: coins are of eight different amounts €0.01 €0.02 €0.05 €0.1 €0.2 €0.5 €1 €2.on every banknote there is a picture of a different european building style
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all banknotes are the same throughout the entire eurozone there are no different designs for different countries unlike the euro coins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one side of each coin is the same in all euro countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the other side is different since each country who mints the coins inserts a symbol relating to that country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today there are many different sets of coins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: any of the coins can be used everywhere throughout the eurozone despite the country specific symbol on the back
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ten new european countries that entered the european union in may 2004 are planning to adopt the euro also
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: first they must meet some conditions to show that they have stable economies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the symbol for the euro is the greek letter epsilon e with two horizontal lines €
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: [[image:euro accession eurozone as single entity.svg|thumb|right|px|2015:some people see it as the latin capital letter c with an equal sign =).it is also legal to simply write euro

lines.value: dental floss is a special type of thread
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is used for cleaning spaces between teeth which cannot be reached by toothbrushes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is important to floss before brushing teeth and to floss at least once a day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tooth brushing will not clean food that is packed between teeth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this food packing can lead to unhealthy teeth and gums
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bacteria grow in this packed food between teeth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these bacteria cause the surface of teeth enamel to break down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then the teeth and gums and sometimes even the jaw can become seriously diseased
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these bacteria that come from the food on the teeth and between the teeth are called plaque or bacterial plaque and also can cause the gums to become less healthy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gingivitis which means gum disease is one type of disease that flossing helps to prevent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: very serious diseases can start on the teeth and move to the bone of the jaw damaging the jaw badly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: flossing your teeth reduces the danger of these serious diseases of the jaw bone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these hard to cure jaw bone diseases are called periodontal disease
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: food that is trapped between the teeth can be uncomfortable and even cause pain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some food is hard for example meat apple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ground meat is soft and so is apple sauce
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chicken and turkey meat are hard and full of fibres and very often get trapped between the teeth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when hard food is trapped between the teeth it can cause discomfort and sometimes pain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when hard food is pressed by the teeth against the gum it can cause pain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people use toothpicks to try to remove trapped food from between the teeth and other people use dental floss to do this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dental floss can do most things that a toothpick can do but dental floss is much thinner than a toothpick and can thus get to places that most toothpicks cannot reach
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so floss presumably does a better job at getting bits of food out from between the teeth relieving discomfort and pain quicker
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a person first starts flossing bleeding can happen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is normal and happens because teeth and gums that are not flossed are less healthy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it will stop as the teeth and gums get healthier with flossing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the september 11 2001 attacks or september 11th or 9/11 were four terrorist attacks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they all happened at the same time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were done by the islamic terrorist group al qaeda
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they attacked the united states in new york city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the attacks took place on tuesday september 11 2001
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: four groups of terrorists each with a trained pilot captured airplanes and flew them into us landmarks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these landmarks were the world trade center's twin towers in new york city and the pentagon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fourth plane crashed in an empty field in pennsylvania before it could reach its target in washington dc after the event the us government said the people who had done the attacks were close to the terrorist group al qaeda
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the events almost 3000 people died
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of them were from the united states but over 300 were from other places such as the united kingdom india and canada
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first of the four planes to depart was american ­airlines flight 11 a boeing 767-200er
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was 159 feet and two inches long with a sixteen foot six inch wide body that allowed for two aisles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the plane made daily flights between boston and los angeles and when it took off at 7:59 a.m on the morning of the eleventh it carried only 81 passengers in its 158 seats
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: forty seven minutes later it crashed into the north tower at 440 mph carrying 9717 gallons of jet fuel 14000 gallons under capacity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: united flight 175 also a boeing 767-200er was the second
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like american airlines 11 it was scheduled to fly between boston and los angeles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when united 175 took off at 8:14 a.m it was even lighter than the american flight only 56 of 168 seats were occupied
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when it crashed into the south tower at 9:03 a.m traveling 540 mph it had 9118 gallons of fuel in its tanks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: american airlines flight 77 was the third plane to take off a boeing 757-200
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aa77 left washington dc at 8:20 a.m bound for los angeles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was two thirds empty with 58 passengers in its 176 seats and its tanks were 4000 gallons under its 11500-gallon capacity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it crashed into the pentagon at 9:37 a.m ­flying 530 mph
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fourth plane united airlines flight 93 was also a 757-200
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was delayed for 42 minutes past its ­scheduled 8 a.m departure from newark new jersey bound for san francisco
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when it finally took off it carried only 37 ­passengers-its capacity was 182-and it was loaded with a little over 7000 gallons of fuel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it crashed at 560 mph into an empty field in shanksville pennsylvania at 10:03 a.m
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all of the 246 people on the four planes died in the crashes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 19 terrorists were also killed in the attacks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both towers of the world trade center caught on fire after the crashes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the south tower 2 wtc burned for 56 minutes before it fell and was destroyed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the north tower 1 wtc burned for 102 minutes before it also fell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the towers fell parts of the towers hit other buildings around them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is believed that because of this damage a third building 7 world trade center 7 wtc fell at 5:20 p.m but this is a debated subject
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many other buildings in the area were damaged badly and had to be demolished later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 2602 people died at the world trade center
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the plane that hit the pentagon hit the ground just as it hit the western side of the building
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it then crashed through three of the five rings that make up the pentagon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the crash killed 125 people in the pentagon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the united states government paid an average of $1.8 million to the families of the victims of the attacks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 2996 people died in the attacks including people such as firemen and policemen trying to save the lives of other people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many conspiracy theories have appeared which say that certain people in the united states government knew about the attacks beforehand or even made them happen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the attack the united states blamed al qaeda which the us thought was a terrorist group
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: president george w bush said he would start a war on terror
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he meant that the united states would do more things to try to stop terrorism in the future
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bush said this was meant to protect americans and their property from terrorists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example the american government would be reorganized
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: security and control in public places was made stronger especially at airports
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: americans were told every day whether there was a serious threat of terrorism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was done by giving a color for the day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: red meant there was a high risk green meant a low risk and there were many levels in between the war on terror also led to real wars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the leader of al qaeda osama bin laden lived in the islamic emirate of afghanistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the united states told the government of afghanistan called the taliban to turn bin laden over to them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the taliban would not do this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the leader of the taliban mullah muhammad omar demanded to see from the united states government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if proof was not given mullah omar said that he would not hand over bin laden
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: president george w bush said that he did not need to provide proof
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the united states then went to war against afghanistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the taliban was removed from power a new government was put in power and a new president was chosen by the people of afghanistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while this was happening the united states government changed in a few ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the united states department of transportation dot created the transportation security administration tsa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before 9/11 security at american airports was provided by the airlines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tsa made it the government's job to provide airport security
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: new officers were hired by tsa to work at airports and to fly on planes as air marshals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tsa also provides security on american trains and subways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a new department of homeland security was also created
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it became their job to protect americans and their property inside the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when this department was created the tsa moved from the dot to homeland security
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after defeating the taliban president george w bush thought the us should invade iraq
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he believed that iraq helped terrorist groups including al qaeda
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said he had evidence that iraq was also making weapons of mass destruction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he sent secretary of state colin powell to the united nations to show them some of the evidence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in march 2003 the united states began its invasion of iraq
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: four other countries also took part including the united kingdom australia poland and denmark the government of iraq was overthrown and the people of iraq elected a new government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: no weapons of mass destruction were found in iraq

lines.value: on may 2 2011 united states navy seals killed al qaeda leader osama bin laden who led the september 11 2001 attacks among other terrorist attempts

lines.value: mario jeckle 25 august 1974 - 11 june 2004 was a german computer scientist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from 1997 to 2003 jeckle attended the university of applied science in augsburg
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1998 he received his computer science degree for his thesis paper prozebkettenmodellierung am beispiel der giebwerkzeugentwicklung und prototypische implementierung auf basis des edm/pdm systems metaphase an example of process chain modelling in casting tool development and prototype implementation on basis of the edm/pdm systems metaphase

lines.value: in 2003 jeckle became a professor at the university of applied sciences in furtwangen

lines.value: pollution is when something is added to the environment harmful or poisonous to all living things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: smoke or dust in the air is a type of pollution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sewage in drinking water is another type of pollution containing germs and viruses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are 3 kinds of pollution water pollution land pollution and air pollution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as pollution grows ways to combat it have grown too
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: solar energy and wind energy give people other ways to power their homes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when people use these alternative forms of energy they put less carbon dioxide into the environment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: air can be polluted by many things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: air can be polluted by various substances such as poisonous gases sulphur dioxide nitrogen dioxide carbon monoxide and very small particulates
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: smoke and harmful gases released by fires industries and thermal power plants cause air pollution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: using coal and wood as fuels for fire cause a lot of air pollution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: petroleum produces less pollution per ton but it causes a lot of pollution since a lot of it is burned globally
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: air pollution may cause breathing problems such as asthma or other health problems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also causes diseases like cancer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: air pollution causes global warming and acid rain which can lead to unpredictable levels of drought worldwide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this makes it difficult for the living organisms to survive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: water pollution is the presence of harmful materials in water such as sewage dissolved metal waste from farms factories and crude oil spilled from oil tankers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the three main substances that pollute water are nitrates from fertilizers sewage and detergents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: activities such as bathing and washing clothes near lakes ponds or rivers add nutrients like nitrate and phosphate into the water bodies.this leads to excessive growth of algae on the surface of water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it blocks the penetration of sunlight and air thus reducing oxygen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it causes harm to organisms living in water and can also harm people's health
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in extreme cases it may cause diseases like cancer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: noise pollution also known as sound pollution is harmful to the brain and hearing of all animals and humans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes the sound of vehicles loud speakers airplanes jets train horns etc noise pollution can cause ear problems or even permanent deafness especially to older people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also causes brain related problems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soil pollution also known as land pollution is caused when man made chemicals such as hydrocarbons heavy metals and solvents get into the soil.these chemicals come from industrial activities and from improper waste in disposal in leaky landfills
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soil pollution can cause health risks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chemicals can produce harmful vapors or they can contaminate water supplies underneath the polluted soil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: plastic pollution is the accumulation of plastic products in the environment that adversely affects wildlife wildlife habitat or humans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is caused because plastic takes thousands of years to decompose or mix in the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thermal pollution is the harmful release of heated liquid into a body of water or heat released into the air as a waste product of a business

lines.value: a common cause of thermal pollution is the use of water as a coolant by power station s and industrial manufacturers

lines.value: this puts back warm water and so raises the temperature and decreases the oxygen content of the water

lines.value: the trans asian railway tar is a project to build a freight railway across europe and asia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tar is a project of the united nations economic and social commission for asia and the pacific unescap
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the project was started in the 1950s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the idea then was to have 8750 miles 14000km of rail link between singapore and istanbul turkey

lines.value: further connections to europe and africa were also considered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at that time there was not as much shipping and air travel as today and the project promised to make shipping faster and cheaper between europe and asia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: progress in developing the tar was slowed by political and economic problems during the 1960s 1970s and early 1980s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the 1990s the end of the cold war and normal relations between some countries made it seem more possible to create a rail network across the asian continent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tar was seen as a way to handle the huge increases in international trade between eurasian nations with easier shipping
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was seen as a way to improve the economies of landlocked countries like laos afghanistan mongolia and the central asian republics and make them easier to reach

lines.value: much of the railway network already exists but there are still some major gaps
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a big challenge is the differences in rail gauge across eurasia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are four different major rail gauges to measure the distance between rails across the continent most of europe as well as turkey iran china and the koreas use the 1435 mm gauge known as standard gauge finland russia and the former soviet republics use a 1520 mm gauge most of the railways in india pakistan bangladesh and sri lanka use a 1676 mm gauge and most of southeast asia has metre gauge

lines.value: in 1590 tokugawa ieyasu made edo his base
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became shogun in 1603 and the town became the center of his military government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this marked the beginning of the edo period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during this time edo grew into one of the largest cities in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more than one million people lived there by the 18th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: edo was not the capital of japan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the emperor lived in the capital kyoto
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however since the shogun was more powerful than the emperor throughout japanese history edo had more power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after about 263 years the meiji restoration removed the shogun from power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1869 the 17-year-old emperor meiji moved to edo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the old edo castle became the imperial palace

lines.value: the tokyo prefecture and the city of tokyo were established
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was the capital city until 1943
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1943 tokyo city and the " municipalities of what was formerly 1869-1943 combined into one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: central tokyo is built around major railway stations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: suburban railways were built relatively cheaply at street level
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are some expressways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tokyo suffered two major catastrophes in the 20th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 1923 great kanto earthquake left 140000 dead or missing world war ii was the other disaster for the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bombing of tokyo in 1944 and 1945 killed between 75000 to 200000 people and destroyed half the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was almost as much damage as the atomic bombs of hiroshima and nagasaki combined
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tokyo was completely rebuilt after the war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 1964 summer olympics were a major world event
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: new high rise developments such as sunshine 60 started in the 1970s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tokyo has a four season climate with rainy summers and dry winters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as of october 2007 about 8.7 million were living in tokyo's 23 special wards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the number of people in tokyo increases to over 15 million during the day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about 2.5 million workers and students enter the city everyday
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the three central wards of chiyoda chuo and minato increase the most
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as of 2005 the regular population in those three areas was only 326000 at night but there are 2.4 million in those areas during the day

lines.value: tokyo has many international residents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as of 2005 the most common groups in tokyo are chinese 123661 koreans 106697 and filipinos 31077

lines.value: americans 18848 british 7696 brazilian 5300 and french 3000 are less common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 23 special wards of tokyo are the same area that had been called tokyo city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on july 1 1943 tokyo city was merged with to become a special government area
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this made the wards different from other wards in japan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other city wards are part of a larger city government but these are not
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each ward is a municipality with its own mayor and assembly like the other cities of japan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the special wards often use the word city in their official english name e.g chiyoda city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the wards have a unique administrative relationship with the prefectural government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tokyo metropolitan government manages some public works such as water sewer and fire fighting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to pay for these things the prefecture collects the municipal taxes usually collected by a city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the special wards of tokyo are three wards of tokyo make up the central part of the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are chiyoda chuo and minato
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tokyo has many sight seeing spots but very few of them are old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are very few buildings in tokyo that are more than 50 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: popular places for visitors range from tokyo tower in the center of the city to mount takao out in the western countryside
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tokyo sky tree is a new tower and is the tallest in japan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: traditional religious sights such as meiji shrine and senso-ji attract many tourists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the imperial castle can be seen in the middle of the city but is not open to the public
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tokyo is the cultural business and political center of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also the center of many transport systems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many air rail sea and road links in and out of the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: local subway and bus systems serve every part of the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two commercial airports serve tokyo

lines.value: haneda airport is in the city limits next to tokyo bay

lines.value: this airport is mostly for domestic travel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most international flights to and from tokyo go through narita airport in chiba prefecture
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: several shinkansen railway lines begin at tokyo station including the tokaido shinkansen going west and tohoku shinkansen going northeast

lines.value: tokyo metro is the city's major subway system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tokyo has a busy international and domestic port but more traffic goes through the nearby port of yokohama
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are domestic ferries to the islands of tokyo but also to other parts of the country such as hokkaido
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many highways meet in tokyo including the chuo kan etsu tohoku and tomei expressways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all highway distances in japan start from zero at a marker in nihonbashi tokyo

lines.value: dr sally kristen ride was an american astronaut and astrophysicist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was the first american woman to reach outer space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ride was born on may 26 1951
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was born in los angeles california
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she earned a phd in physics from stanford university
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she joined nasa in 1978
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was an astronaut until 1987
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in order to be an astronaut and go into space sally ride had to train for a year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: training included adapting to gravity water survival radio communications and navigation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she went on the space shuttle challenger in june 1983
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this trip was the first time an american woman was in space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she helped design the robot arm for the space shuttle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the robot arm lifts heavy objects in space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ride was the first person to use the robot arm in space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the robot arm put a satellite in space that showed how the sun affected weather
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ride flew to space twice

lines.value: she worked on the commissions that investigated the space shuttle challenger and space shuttle columbia disasters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ride became a professor in 1989

lines.value: she was the professor of physics and director of the oaklahoma space institute at the university of california
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was married to astronaut steven hawley from 1982 until they divorced in 1987

lines.value: she was dating writer tam o'shaughnessy until her death on july 23 2012 from cancer.[2]

lines.value: a screw is a sharp piece of threaded metal similar to a nail
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike a nail a screw has spiral grooves down its spike
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a screw is pressed down against wood and turned with a screwdriver
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the grooves cut into the wood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this prevents the screw from falling out as a nail might
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: screws can be made of steel iron brass bronze plastic etc.there are also machine screws and self tapping screws
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: machine screws are bolts which have screw threads
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the threads matched with nuts with female threads
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: screw threads are measured either in millimeters or in numbers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are used in furniture doors appliances etc
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: screwing is the neatest way of holding together two materials
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if no glue is involved then the screwing can be dismantled
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are three different types of screw
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: use the right size screwdriver for the screw head
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a screwdriver that is too slim can damage the slot too wide can tear the materials
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: screw threads in both wood and metal can become stripped resulting in loss of holding power and can also be difficult to remove

lines.value: harrison is the only president to be the grandson of former president william henry harrison
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: harrison was the first president of the united states to use electricity in the white house

lines.value: after benjamin harrison served one full four year term as president cleveland ran again and this time beat harrison
lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the american civil war harrison was a colonel in the union army later a brevet brigadier general

lines.value: he argued many cases before the united states supreme court

lines.value: ayyavazhi (, path of the father is a religion with one god that started in south india in the middle of the 19th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the zhi () in the word ayyavazhi is a retroflex ri.ayyavazhi is not a part of hinduism but since it was not considered a separate religion it was considered as a branch of hinduism only officially
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has evolved into a different religion spreading in tamil nadu's southern districts of kanyakumari tirunelveli and tuticorin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as one of the fastest growing religions of southern india its growth had been noted in the christian missionary reports of the mid 19th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ideas and philosophy of the religion are based on the teachings of ayya vaikundar and the religious texts akilattirattu ammanai and arul nool
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ayyavazhi began to be seen firstly by the large number of people gathering to worship ayya vaikundar at swamithoppe which is at that time poovandanthoppe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the majority of the followers of ayyavazhi were from the poor group of the society
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for the christian missionaries it gives a big challenge in their converting mission from its beginning
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although the majority of these followers were from the chanar cast apart from ayyavazhi sources some outer sources too says that a large number of people from other castes also followed this religion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the middle of nineteenth century ayyavazhi had come to be recognised as a separate religion grown well in the region of south travancore and south tirunelveli
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the growth in its number of followers had increased speedly from 1840s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the death of vaikundar the religion was spread on the basis of his teachings and the religious books akilattirattu ammanai and arul nool
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the five citars who were the deciples of ayya vaikundar and their descendants travelled to several parts of the country and carried the mission of ayyavazhi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at that time the payyan dynasty started ruling of swamithoppe pathi while other pathis came under the control of the followers of ayya
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hundreds of nizhal thangals places of worship were built across the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: currently bala prajapathi adikalar one of descendant of payyan dynasty is said to be as the leader of ayyavazhi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he has laid foundations for a large number of nizhal thangals all over south india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: and now seeing the growth of the religion the day of birth of vaikundar ayya vaikunda avataram was announced as a holiday by the government for the districts of tirunelveli and tuticorin from this year while the district of kanyakumari was announced as a holiday earlier
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the holy books of ayyavazhi are the akilattirattu ammanai and the arul nool and they are the source of the religion's mythology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the holy book states that the akilattirattu ammanai was written down by hari gopalan citar by hearing the contents of akilam told by narayana to his wife lakshmi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was no definite history about the beginning of arul nool but the followers believe that it was written by citars and by those who get possessed by divine power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it contains the prayers hymns and ways for the worship in ayyavazhi religious practices prophesies and also many rules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to the ayyavazhi devotees there are five holy places called pathis with panchappathis as the most important
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the temple of swamithoppepathi is the head of the ayyavazhi religion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the vakaippathi where 700 families were sent to thuvayal thavasu by vaikundar was approved as a pathi in akilam although this place has no direct association with the activities of vaikundar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is a big disagreement within the followers of ayyavazhi as to the holiness of some of the places of worship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the avatharappathi in thiruchendur was accepted by the book akilam as a pathi but as some of the followers believe that the place at which the present temple is located is not the exact place where ayya vaikundar incarnated from the sea they disagree with the other devotees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are also some followers which strongly quarrel thiruchendur as a pathi though they accept it as a secondary holy site
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium is chemical element 37 on the periodic table
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its symbol is rb
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its atomic mass is 85.47
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has 37 protons and 37 electrons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a soft silver colored metal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was first discovered in 1861 by robert bunsen and gustav kirchoff in heidelberg germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium melts at a very low temperature for example it could melt in a person's hand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium is an alkali metal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can make an amalgam with mercury
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium is very reactive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it will ignite in air because it reacts with many other elements in the air like oxygen and nitrogen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium reacts very violently with water to make hydrogen and rubidium hydroxide a strong corrosive base
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reaction is normally very hot so the hydrogen ignites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium forms chemical compounds in only one oxidation state +1
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some rubidium compounds have a mixed oxidation state though
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium chloride is the most common rubidium compound
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium hydroxide and rubidium carbonate are also used commonly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium compounds makes a redviolet color in a flame
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most rubidium compounds are colorless
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium compounds are not as common as other alkali metal compounds such get sodium compounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: otherwise they are similar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium is about as common as zinc
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the 23rd most common element in the earth's crust
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most minerals only have a small amount of rubidium in them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it normally comes in small quantities in other minerals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is made by reduction of rubidium ores with calcium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is expensive because calcium is difficult to make and the rubidium needs to be kept in argon and away from water or air
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are not many common uses for rubidium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium compounds are sometimes used in purple fireworks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it and its compounds are used mainly in science research though
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also used to make superoxide ions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is used in some special types of glass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rubidium compounds are not very dangerous in the human body however if a person gets too much from eating they could get sick because it acts like other alkali metal ions such as sodium ions in sodium chloride
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rats can live with up to half of their potassium replaced with rubidium though it is not likely for that to happen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a subtropical cyclone also known as a subtropical storm is a cyclonic weather storm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: subtropical cyclones have wide wind patterns with the winds getting stronger as they get farther away from the centre of the storm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a subtropical cyclone is more likely to be a tropical cyclone than an extratropical cyclone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: subtropical cyclones are only found in the northern atlantic ocean and in the eastern pacific ocean
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like normal tropical cyclones most subtropical cyclones have maximum wind speeds of at least 39 mph to 74 mph 60 km h to 110 km h
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: subtropical cyclones that have wind speeds less than 39 mph are known as subtropical depressions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the 1950s and 60s subtropical cyclones were simply called semi tropical
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was much discussion between meteorologists in the late 1960s as of what a subtropical cyclone was
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so in 1972 the national hurricane center nhc officially classified the type under a new category different from actual tropical cyclones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the 1970s the nhc began making a new list of names separate for subtropical cyclones although that process was soon canceled because it was rejected by many scientists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after that subtropical storms were just numbered such as hurricane karen from 2001 which was originally named subtropical storm one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but in 2002 a policy change had tropical and subtropical storms share the same list of names for the whole season which started with subtropical storm nicole in 2004
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 2004 atlantic hurricane season the nhc watched the first named subtropical cyclone its name was subtropical storm nicole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later another unnamed subtropical cyclone was discovered in the 2005 atlantic hurricane season after someone reread the records
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although it could have been named the subtropical storm remained without a name because it was only identified a long time after the official season had finished
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a third subtropical cyclone was named subtropical storm andrea which formed on may 9 just before the start of the 2007 atlantic hurricane season
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a subtropical cyclone can form in many ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most common type of a subtropical cyclone is an upper level cold low with circulation expanding to the surface layer and strongest winds usually happening at a radius of about 100 miles/160 kilometers or more from the center
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another type of a subtropical cyclone is a mesoscale low forming in or near an area of horizontal wind shear also known as a dying frontal zone with radius of strongest winds normally less than 30 miles 50 kilometers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the entire circulation may originally have a diameter of less than 100 miles/160 kilometres
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these cyclones usually last for a short time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they may be either cold core or warm core and for some time in 1972 this type of subtropical cyclone was called a neutercane
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as of 2006 the warm core type was moved under the definition of the term tropical cyclone and removed from the subtropical cyclone definition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ambiguity means that what a thing is is not clear
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: literally the word refers to a choice between two different things

lines.value: in the proper sense it should mean two different meanings because ambi comes from the greek word for two
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we see things happen and then we decide what they mean
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if we cannot decide what is going on the event is ambiguous

lines.value: this is an extension of the original use of the word
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: words or sentences that are ambiguous can lead to misunderstandings people get the wrong meaning
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can sometimes be serious but it can also be funny
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jokes often rely on ambiguity

lines.value: the sentence the peasants are revolting is ambiguous because it could mean a mother says to her little boy johnny go over the road and see how old mrs jones is

lines.value: this is obviously how johnny understood his mother's instruction
