lines.value: the prayer to the sacred heart of jesus is a roman catholic devotion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a devotion is something that people do or say to show their love for god and jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: saint margaret mary alacoque wrote the prayer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when roman catholics pray to the sacred heart of jesus they are praying for a part of jesus that they believe is divine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the devotion to the sacred heart of jesus is also popular among some anglo catholic anglicans anglicans who use many of the same practices as catholics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: early christians for example john the evangelist and paul of tarsus wrote the first devotions or prayers to the love of god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earliest devotions to the sacred heart of jesus were from the benedictine or cistercian monastery plural monasteries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: st bernard of clairveaux from the cistercian religious order was possibly the first person to write a devotion to the sacred heart of jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but some people believe that the first person was st.anselm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the devotion of the sacred heart of jesus started to be more popular between the 13th century and the sixteenth century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some religious orders for example the franciscans dominicans and carthusians practised the devotion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but the devotion of the sacred heart of jesus was most common with individual christians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for many individual christians the devotion of the sacred heart of jesus was a mystical devotion similar to an experience in mysticism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the sixteenth century there was a change in the way people practised the devotion of the sacred heart of jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the devotion started to be part of christian asceticism and stopped being part of christian mysticism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the sixteenth century the devotion of the sacred heart of jesus also started to use special written prayers and exercises
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example the devotion used the writings of lanspergius d
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 1539 of the carthusians of cologne and of louis of blois blosius 1566 who was a benedictine and abbot of liessies in hainaut
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the devotion also used or followed the writing of john of avila d
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 1569 and st francis de sales who lived in the seventeenth century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the seventeenth century writers who followed christian asceticism wrote about the devotion of the sacred heart of christian jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example ascetic writers from the society of jesus wrote about the devotion many times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the image of the sacred heart of jesus became very common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was popular because many people used the image in the franciscan devotion to the five wounds explanation needed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the image of the sacred heart of jesus also became popular because many jesuits members of the society of jesus put the image of the sacred heart of jesus on the first page of their books and on the walls of their churches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but the devotion of the sacred heart of jesus continued to be a private and mostly individual devotion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jean eudes 1602-1680 made it a public devotion gave it a religious office needs explanation and created a feast for it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pere eudes was the apostle of the heart of mary but in his devotion to the immaculate heart there was a share for the heart of jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: little by little the devotion to the sacred heart became a separate one and on august 31 1670 the first feast of the sacred heart was celebrated in the grand seminary of rennes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: coutances followed suit on october 20 a day with which the eudist feast was from then on to be connected
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the feast soon spread to other dioceses and the devotion was likewise adopted in various religious communities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it gradually came into contact with the devotion begun at paray and resulting in a fusion of the two
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most significant source for the devotion to the sacred heart in the form it is known today was a nun of the religious congregation of the visitation of mary saint margaret mary alacoque 1647-1690 who claimed to have received visions of jesus christ
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is nothing to indicate that she had known the devotion prior to the revelations or at least that she had paid any attention to it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these alleged revelations were numerous and the following apparitions are especially remarkable on december 27 probably 1673 the feast of st john margaret mary reported that jesus permitted her as he had formerly allowed st gertrude to rest her head upon his heart and then disclosed to her the wonders of his love telling her that he desired to make them known to all mankind and to diffuse the treasures of his goodness and that he had chosen her for this work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in probably june or july 1674 margaret mary claimed that jesus requested to be honored under the figure of his heart of flesh also claiming that when he appeared radiant with love he asked for a devotion of expiatory love frequent reception of communion especially communion on the first friday of the month and the observance of the holy hour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the octave of corpus christi 1675 probably on june 16 the vision known as the great apparition reportedly took place where jesus said behold the heart that has so loved men instead of gratitude i receive from the greater part of mankind only ingratitude ", and asked margaret mary for a feast of reparation of the friday after the octave of corpus christi bidding her consult father de la colombiere then superior of the small jesuit house at paray
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: solemn homage was asked on the part of the king and the mission of propagating the new devotion was especially confided to the religious of the visitation and to the priests of the society of jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few days after the great apparition margaret mary reported everything she saw to father de la colombiere and he acknowledging the vision as an action of the spirit of god consecrated himself to the sacred heart and directed her to write an account of the apparition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also made use of every available opportunity to circulate this account discreetly through france and england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at his death february 15 1682 there was found in his journal of spiritual retreats a copy in his own handwriting of the account that he had requested of margaret mary together with a few reflections on the usefulness of the devotion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this journal including the account and an offering to the sacred heart in which the devotion was well explained was published at lyons in 1684
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the little book was widely read even at paray
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: margaret mary reported feeling dreadful confusion over the book's contents but resolved to make the best of it approving of the book for the spreading of her cherished devotion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: outside of the visitandines priests religious and laymen espoused the devotion particularly a capuchin margaret mary's two brothers and some jesuits among the latter being fathers croiset and gallifet who promoted the devotion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the death of margaret mary october 17 1690 did not dampen the zeal of those interested on the contrary a short account of her life published by father croiset in 1691 as an appendix to his book de la devotion au sacre cœur served only to increase it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in spite of all sorts of obstacles and of the slowness of the holy see which in 1693 imparted indulgences to the confraternities of the sacred heart and in 1697 granted the feast to the visitandines with the mass of the five wounds but refused a feast common to all with special mass and office
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the devotion spread particularly in religious communities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the marseilles plague 1720 furnished perhaps the first occasion for a solemn consecration and public worship outside of religious communities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other cities of the south followed the example of marseilles and thus the devotion became a popular one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1726 it was deemed advisable once more to importune rome for a feast with a mass and office of its own but in 1729 rome again refused
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however in 1765 it finally yielded and that same year at the request of the queen the feast was received quasi officially by the episcopate of france
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on all sides it was asked for and obtained and finally in 1856 at the urgent entreaties of the french bishops pope pius ix extended the feast to the catholic church under the rite of double major
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1889 it was raised by the catholic church to the double rite of first class
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on may 15 2006 pope benedict xvi sent a letter to fatherpeter hans kolvenbach the superior general of the society of jesus on the 50th anniversary of the encyclical haurietis aquas about the sacred heart by pope pius xii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in his letter to father kolvenbach pope benedict reaffirmed the importance of the devotion to the sacred heart of jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the catholic acts of consecration reparation and devotion were introduced when the feast of the sacred heart was declared
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in his papal bull auctorem fidei pope pius vi praised devotion to the sacred heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: finally by order of leo xiii in his encyclical annum sacrum may 25 1899 as well as on june 11 he consecrated every human to the sacred heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the idea of this act which leo xiii called the great act of his pontificate had been proposed to him by a religious woman of the good shepherd from oporto portugal who said that she had supernaturally received it from jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since c 1850 groups congregations and states have consecrated themselves to the sacred heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: peter coudrin of france founded the congregation of the sacred hearts of jesus and mary on dec 24 1800
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a religious order of the roman catholic church the order is best known for its missionary work in hawaii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: worship of the sacred heart mainly consists of several hymns the salutation of the sacred heart and the litany of the sacred heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is common in roman catholic services and occasionally is to be found in anglican services
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the feast of the sacred heart is a holy day in the roman catholic liturgical calendar and is celebrated 19 days after pentecost
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as pentecost is always celebrated on sunday the feast of the sacred heart always falls on a friday
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the enthronement of the sacred heart is a catholic ceremony in which a priest or head of a household consecrates the members of the household to the sacred heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a blessed image of the sacred heart either a statue or a picture is then enthroned in the home to serve as a constant reminder to those who dwell in the house of their consecration to the sacred heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the practice of the enthronement is based upon pope pius xii's declaration that devotion to the sacred of jesus is the foundation on which to build the kingdom of god in the hearts of individuals families and nations..."[4]
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sacred heart is still a widely used name for many catholic institutions including schools colleges and hospitals in many countries around the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also the name of many catholic parishes religious orders and stores selling catholic goods

lines.value: religious imagery depicting the sacred heart is frequently featured in catholic and sometimes anglican homes

lines.value: sometimes images display beneath them a list of family members indicating that the entire family is entrusted to the protection of jesus in the sacred heart from whom blessings on the home and the family members are sought

lines.value: many members of the carlist military forces of the 19th and 20th centuries in spain wore detentes or amulets with an image of the sacred heart

lines.value: some non catholics including charismatic protestants have criticized devotion to the sacred heart as idolatry in that worship is directed towards a body part

lines.value: in music organ is a word that can mean several kinds of musical instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word comes from the greek ὄpyavov organon which means organ "", or .most organs are played using keyboards one or more of which may be played using the feet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are found and used in churches concert halls and even in theatres especially older movie theatres or cinemas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a person who plays the organ is called an organist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: here are some different types of organs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pipe organs are the most common kind of organ and many people mean this kind of organ when they use the word organ
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they sound different notes when air flows through pipes of different lengths and types
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they take up a lot of room and the noise they make are meant to fill large spaces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earliest pipe organs were water organs which were powered by the flow of water sometimes from a natural resource or using a pump
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later ones used foot pedals or hand cranks to pump a bellows which in turn produces the air that goes through the pipes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these kinds of organs are still made today and are called harmoniums
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today's pipe organs ones use an electric motor to move air and some like those in theaters play different instruments as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the wurlitzer company was well known for making instruments that make different sounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mechanical organs have a mechanism that controls which notes are played and when they are played
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one type of mechanical organ is the barrel organ which usually get their music printed on cardboard sheets although some use piano rolls or a barrel similar to that of a carillon or music box
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mechanical organs can be all shapes and sizes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the smaller barrel organs are often heard on streets in europe and is a common way of getting money from people who pass by
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these types are sometimes called hurdy gurdies but this is not true
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: larger barrel organs can be found on fairgrounds and are loud so that they can be heard above all the other noise at a fair
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: meanwhile smaller barrel organs can be found indoors and play songs when someone puts in a coin similar to a slot machine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some clocks have barrel organ mechanisms that play music at certain times such as every hour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the electronic organ is one of the newest types of organ
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they use electronics to simulate the sound of a pipe organ and many other instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this they do not need to be very big and many are no bigger than a piano so that they can fit in homes schools or can be moved around as needed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also do not go out of tune because it holds all its sounds on computerized chips
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many organists think they do not feel as good to play as a traditional mechanical pipe organ
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are electronic organs that look and sound like those played in churches and even many churches use electronic organs when they do not have the money or space for a full pipe organ
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the best known electronic organs include the hammond organ heard in jazz and other organs like those made by the japanese company yamaha are in fact synthesizers that can sound like a whole orchestra playing together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these types of organs are often used for music education especially in asia

lines.value: the jurassic is the second geological period in the mesozoic era
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it began 201.3 million years ago and ended 145 million years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the jurassic period happened between the triassic and cretaceous periods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the jurassic period the climate was hotter and wetter than it is today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: carbon dioxide levels and sea levels were also higher than today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kimmeridge clay of the upper jurassic was laid down in an environment which does not exist on the earth today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: much of western europe was covered by a high sea level
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the supercontinent pangaea was beginning to break up causing a narrow atlantic ocean
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this the united kingdom was covered by a shallow and largely anoxic sea perhaps less than 100 metres deep with occasional landmasses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was shallower water than the blue lias of the lower jurassic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was often low in oxygen which caused its organic material to decompose but only partially
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the jurassic's mudstones are organic rich and gave rise to most of the north sea oil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the early jurassic the supercontinent pangaea broke up into the northern supercontinent laurasia and the southern supercontinent gondwana
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was the start of the break up of pangaea a process which took a long time to complete
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the process of pulling apart in geology is called rifting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: floods of lava flowed from fissures splits and volcanos
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the end of the jurassic south america had begun to part from africa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the western part of north america mountain ranges began to form
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this continued as the american tectonic plates gradually moved west
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the westward moving north american plates gradually rode over the pacific ocean plates to form the rocky mountains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on sea and land evolutionary trends which started in the upper triassic continued through the jurassic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: archosaurian reptiles dominated the land biota
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: reptile groups radiated and filled many niches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dinosaurs pterosaurs marine reptiles ichthyosaurs plesiosaurs turtles all flourished
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: amongst invertebrates there was much change
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: modern predators like starfish crabs and hole boring gastropods took over the sea floor eating the benthic fauna in huge numbers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: brachiopods lost their grip on the in shore habitats molluscan bivalves took their place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: early mammals existed but mostly as small creatures living in burrows on the margins of a reptilian world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first fossils of small dinosaurs with feathers called anchiornis come from the jurassic period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first fossil bird archaeopteryx comes from the upper jurassic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dominant land plants were the gymnosperms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kano is a city in nigeria

lines.value: kano is the third largest city in nigeria after ibadan and lagos
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about 3626204 people live in kano

lines.value: it has long been the economic centre of northern nigeria and a centre for the sale of groundnuts

lines.value: kano is known for the bayero university and a railway station with trains to lagos moving through kaduna while kano international airport can be found nearby

lines.value: kano has long been a centre for nigeria's islamic culture one of the country's finest mosques lies in the city

lines.value: it is also the site where the kano river project was developed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is a large irrigation scheme
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city of kano was founded around ad 1000 as an hausa city of its own
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kano remained a big emirate or muslim kingdom until the making of the country nigeria in 1903
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kano became known for its trade in gold leather ivory salt and slaves within the area
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this perhaps is the reason for the city's wealth and power in the 14th century when islam gained a growing following

lines.value: by the 15th century the first central mosque had been built in the city

lines.value: eucalyptus is a genus of trees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are over 700 species of eucalypts and almost all of them are in australia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts can be found in almost every part of the australia and they are adapted to many different habitats
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalyptus is one of three similar genera that are commonly referred to as eucalypts the others being corymbia and angophora
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many species but far from all are known as gum trees because they exude copious sap from any break in the bark
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts have many local names like gum trees mallee box ironbark stringybark and ash
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts have special flowers and fruits that no other trees have
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when it flowers a bud cap made of petals grows around the flower until it is ready to open
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then the bud cap falls off to reveal a flower with no petals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the woody fruits are called gumnuts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are roughly cone shaped and open at one end to release the seeds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nearly all eucalypts are evergreen but some tropical species lose their leaves at the end of the dry season
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the leaves are covered with oil glands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these oils are often used to treat coughs and colds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many eucalypts also change the shape of their leaves as they get older
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: young eucalypts have round leaves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when one to a few years old the leaves of most kinds become longer and spearhead or sickle shaped
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few kinds keep the round leaf shape all their lives
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most species do not flower until the adult leaves starts to appear
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bark dies every year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in smooth barked trees most of the bark falls off the tree leaving a smooth surface that is often colourfully marked
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with rough barked trees the dead bark stays on the tree and dries out
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many kinds of eucalyptus trees have smooth bark at the top but rough bark lower down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these different kinds of bark are used to arrange the eucalypts into groups this is useful because there are hundreds of kinds of eucalypts and breaking down the group in this way makes the group easier to understand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the different groups are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today specimens of the australian mountain ash are among the tallest trees in the world at up to 92 metres in height and the tallest of all flowering plants taller trees such as the coast redwood are all conifers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is evidence that at the time of european settlement of australia some mountain ash were indeed the tallest plants in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most eucalypts cannot survive frost or can only stand light frosts down to -3 °c to -5 °c
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hardiest eucalypts are the so called snow gums such as eucalyptus pauciflora which is capable of withstanding cold and frost down to about -20 °c
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two sub species wild varieties of this tree can survive even colder winters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: several other kinds especially from the high plateau and mountains of central tasmania have produced extreme cold hardy forms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is seed from these hardy strains that are planted for ornamental trees in colder parts of the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an oil found in eucalyptus leaves is a strong natural disinfectant which is used in some medicines but can be poisonous if too much is taken
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: several marsupials such as koalas and some possums are partly resistant to it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these animals can tell which plants are safe to eat by their smell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts make a lot of nectar providing food for many insects
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts have a habit of dropping entire branches off as they grow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalyptus forests are littered with dead branches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the australian ghost gum eucalyptus papuana is sometimes called the widow maker due to the high number of tree felling workers who were killed by falling branches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many deaths were actually caused by simply camping under them as the trees shed whole and very large branches to save water during droughts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for this reason you should never camp under large eucalyptus branches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on warm days eucalyptus oil vapour rises above the bush to create the well known distant blue haze of the australian landscape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalyptus oil catches fire very easily and bush fires can travel quickly through the oil rich air of the tree crowns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dead bark and fallen branches are also flammable
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts are well adapted for periodic fires in fact most species are dependent on them for spread and regeneration
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they do this in several ways by sprouting from underground tubers hidden buds under their bark and from seeds sprouting in the ashes after the fire has opened them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts began between 35 and 50 million years ago not long after australia and new guinea separated from gondwana
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their coming coincides with an increase in fossil charcoal deposits which might mean that fire was important to them even then but they remained a minor component of the rainforest until about 20 million years ago when the gradual drying of the continent and lessening of soil richness led to the growth of a more open forest type with mainly casuarina and acacia trees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with the arrival of the first humans about 50 thousand years ago fires became much more frequent and the fire loving eucalypts soon came to account for roughly 70% of australian forest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts grow back quickly after fire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the two valuable timber trees alpine ash and mountain ash are killed by fire and only grow back from seeds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the same fire which had little impact on forests around canberra has resulted in thousands of hectares of dead forests
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts have many uses which have made them important
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of their fast growth the main benefit of these trees is the wood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they provide many uses such as planting in parks and gardens timber firewood and pulpwood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fast growth also makes eucalypts suitable as windbreaks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts draw a very large amount of water from the soil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they have been planted or replanted in some places to lower the water table and reduce the amount of salt in the soil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts have also been used as a way of reducing malaria by draining the soil in such places as algeria sicily mainland europe and california
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: drainage removes swamps which provide a habitat for mosquito larvae but such drainage can also destroy harmless habitats by accident
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalyptus oil is refined from the leaves by steaming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be used for cleaning deodorising and in very small amounts in food supplements especially sweets cough drops and decongestants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalyptus oil is an insect repellent fradin & day 2002
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the nectar of some eucalyptus produces high quality honey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the western united states the flowering is in late january before the flowering of other nut and fruit trees this means that its nectar can be easily made into its own kind of honey which is said to have a buttery taste
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ghost gum's leaves were used by aborigines to catch fish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soaking the leaves in water releases a mild tranquiliser which stuns fish making them easy to catch
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalyptus is also used to make the digeridoo a musical wind instrument made popular by the aborigines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalypts were first introduced to the rest of the world by sir joseph banks botanist on the cook expedition in 1770
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they have since been introduced to many parts of the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: several species have become invasive spreading out of the area they were planted in and are causing major problems for local wildlife
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in spain they have been planted in pulpwood plantations replacing native oak woodland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as in other such areas while the original woodland supports kinds of native animal life the eucalypt groves cannot support the local wildlife leading to silent forests and the decline of wildlife populations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on the other hand eucalypts helps several industries such as sawmilling pulp and charcoal making
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 1850s many australians traveled to california to take part in the california gold rush
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: much of california has similar climate to parts of australia and some people had the idea of introducing eucalypts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the early 1900s thousands of hectares of eucalypts were planted with the encouragement of the state government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was hoped that they would provide a renewable source of timber for construction and furniture making
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however this did not happen partly because the trees were cut when they were too young and partly because the americans did not know how to process the cut trees to prevent the wood from twisting and splitting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one way in which the eucalypts mainly the blue gum proved valuable in california was in providing windbreaks for highways orange groves and other farms in the mostly treeless central part of the state
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are also admired as shade and ornamental trees in many cities and gardens
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eucalyptus forests in california have been criticized because they drive out the native plants and do not support native animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fire is also a problem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 1991 oakland hills firestorm which destroyed almost 3000 homes and killed 25 people was partly fueled by large numbers of eucalyptus in the area close to the houses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some parts of california eucalypt forests are being removed and native trees and plants restored
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people have also illegally destroyed some trees and are suspected of bringing in insect pests from australia which attack the trees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1910 eucalypts were introduced to brazil for timber substitution and the charcoal industry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: regrettably the long term effects were not studied and in the present the eucalyptus is causing problems because of its high consumption of water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this causes the soil to dry out killing many local plants which the local animals need to survive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a plastic is a material that can change its shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many things are made of plastics usually because making them the right shape is easy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many types of plastic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some can be shaped only when they are freshly made then they become hard
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: others are thermoplastic and can be softened by heating them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most plastics are man made they do not occur in nature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the process of making plastics is usually quite complicated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the materials that are called plastic are polymers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: polymers are long chains of atoms bonded to each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in most plastics the long chain is a chain of carbon atoms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people experimented with plastics based on natural polymers for a very long time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alexander parkes an english inventor 1813-1890 created the earliest form of plastic in 1855
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was hard but flexible and transparent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he called it parkesine but now it is called celluloid old plastics are usually thrown away and put in landfills
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some plastics release toxic fumes when burned
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: plastics are often recycled so they won't become waste
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: plastics are mostly petrochemicals made from natural gas or from petroleum a type of oil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chemical engineers refine the petroleum which goes through a heating process
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it develops ethylene and propylene which are the chemical building blocks for many plastics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these chemicals are then combined with other chemicals to produce a polymer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spamming is when one person or company sends an unwanted email to another person
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spam emails are the computer version of unwanted junk mail that arrives in a mailbox such as advertising pamphlets and brochures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spam emails are usually sent to try to get the person to buy something or do something else that will cause gain for the sender
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the emails sent when someone is spamming is called spam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the person or company who sent the unwanted email is called a spammer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both of these words came from a brand of canned meat called spam but it was a short sketch created by the british comedy group monty python in 1970 that led to the word spam being widely used to mean unwanted email messages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spam emails are usually sent to many at once trying to get them to buy a product or sign up for a service
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the people who the email did not ask to receive the email and do not want to receive it.one of the reasons there is so much spam emails around is that it costs very little to send millions of spam messages at once
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spam messages can easily be sent sometimes even by a special computer program
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hardest part about spamming is to get the email addresses to send the spam to
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes the spammers do this by searching for emails on the internet or by buying emails from people who know a lot of them for example someone who runs a site that makes users tell them their email address to signup will have a lot of email addresses to sell to spammers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one part of getting e mail addresses is to find addresses that are still in use
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one trick used by spammers is to put a link at the end of a message like this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another trick that spammers use is to put a picture - even one that cannot be seen - into a spam message
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the picture will have a name that goes with just that one email
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the email is opened a request will be sent to the server that has that picture to get the image
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if they get this request then they know that you read their email which could cause a person to receive even more email spam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word spamming is also used to describe the act of typing a lot of words or text in internet chat rooms so that other people using the chatroom cannot carry on conversations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually this blocks the screen with meaningless words in order to annoy the other people in the chatroom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spamming in internet chatrooms is usually considered to be
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this kind of behavior is usually called flooding rather than spamming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word spam is often mistakenly applied to emails containing content that the receiver sees as silly or simply meaningless e.g yujhcykgfvylfuv,uyguvgy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: computer users at home and in workplaces waste a lot of time opening and deleting spam messages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some cases spam emails contain viruses or links to pornography or illegal gambling websites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spam emails often advertise products or services which are being lied about by the companies sending the spam such as frauds or scams
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some user email programs can automatically delete spam messages when they arrive or move them to a separate spam folder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet service providers also detect them automatically and cooperate to cut off customers who are major spammers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a desktop environment is a location on a personal computer that helps the user get around on the computer

lines.value: in normal cosmology comoving distance or proper distance is one of several distances measured by cosmologists to define distances between objects
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to talk about the shape of the universe scientists want to forget that the universe is expanding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so they separate the shape from time and pretend that the universe is not expanding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they remember that really the universe is expanding but they write this in a variable called the scale factor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then the distances they talk about while putting the scale factor to the side are called comoving distances
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when they think about the universe using comoving distance they think of the universe as not expanding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this way some calculations are easier
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the part of the universe which we can see today started it was very small
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: everything in this part of the universe was much closer together than today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was also very hot and photons particles of light were moving in different directions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thomas hobbes 5 april 1588 4 december 1679 was a philosopher from england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his most famous book is leviathan 1651
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hobbes mainly wrote about government and law he was a political philosopher
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he tried to show that the best kind of government has one in which society was organised under one authority
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all individuals in that society give up some rights for the sake of protection
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is no doctrine of separation of powers in hobbes's discussion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to him the sovereign power must control military judicial and ecclesiastical powers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most interesting thing about hobbes was the way he argued
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he started by looking at human nature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said that humans are very selfish and that we are willing to hurt each other if we think it will help us
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also said that naturally humans are all equal because we are all strong enough to kill each other even a child can kill a strong man while he sleeps
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then he imagined what things would be like without a government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he said that it would be terrible a state of war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there would not be enough stuff for everyone and people would disagree about who got what
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people would fight each other and everyone else would be very worried about their own safety
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: no one would be able to trust anyone else or make plans for the future
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: life would be solitary poor nasty brutish and short people would be alone poor mean and would not live for long
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: next hobbes argues that it would be a good idea for everyone to stop fighting and choose a sovereign which could be one man or an assembly of men
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: everyone should agree to obey the sovereign and give him all power of coercion or force of restraint under law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: once the sovereign is in place everyone has to obey him even those who disagree with him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because everyone already agreed to obey him no matter what
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hobbes says it's better to be mostly safe under an all powerful sovereign than to be in a state of war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hobbes wanted his argument to be like math with each step leading to the next
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however many people disagreed with his argument
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some said that hobbes was in favor of rebellion because he said that people were naturally equal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: others said that humans are not as selfish as hobbes thought
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today most people do not like the idea of an all powerful government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nevertheless hobbes's argument was a very important one and philosophers who are interested in government or political theory still study hobbes's books very carefully

lines.value: anne frank (; 12 june 1929 in frankfurt am main - february 1945 in bergen belsen is one of the most famous jewish people who died in the holocaust

lines.value: several plays and movies have been made about it.anne was born in the city frankfurt am main in weimar germany

lines.value: she was officially seen as a german until 1941

lines.value: she became famous around the world after her death when her diary was printed

lines.value: it showed her experiences hiding during the german occupation of the netherlands in world war ii

lines.value: the frank family moved from germany to holland's capital amsterdam in 1933

lines.value: this was the same year that the nazis grew powerful in germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the beginning of 1940 because of the nazi occupation of the netherlands they were trapped in amsterdam

lines.value: of jewish people increased in july 1942 and the family decided to hide

lines.value: they hid in the secret rooms of her father otto frank's office building
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after two years they were and taken to concentration camps

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there they both died from typhus in february 1945
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: otto frank was the only person in his family who survived

lines.value: he went back to amsterdam after the war and found that anne's diary had been saved

lines.value: he helped print it in 1947

lines.value: it has been translated into many languages

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it tells of her life from 12 june 1942 until 1 august 1944

lines.value: he had a large library and both parents encouraged the children to read

lines.value: acts of antisemitism began almost immediately

lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the magna carta was a document signed by king john after negotiations with his barons and their french and scots allies at runnymede surrey england in 1215
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there they sealed the great charter called in latin magna carta
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it established a council of 25 barons to see john kept to the clauses including access to swift justice parliamentary assent for taxation scutage limitations and protection from illegal imprisonment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because he was forced to seal the charter john sought approval to break it from his spiritual overlord pope innocent iii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denouncing it as not only shameful and demeaning but also illegal and unjust the pope agreed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magna carta has influenced english law down to the present day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is one of the most celebrated documents in the history of england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is recognised as a cornerstone of the idea of the liberty of citizens
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magna carta contains 63 clauses written in latin on parchment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: only three of the original clauses in magna carta are still law today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one defends the freedom and rights of the english church another confirms the liberties and customs of the city of london and other towns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this clause translated is the main reason the carta is still famous :"no free man shall be seized or imprisoned or stripped of his rights or possessions or outlawed or exiled
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nor will we proceed with force against him except by the lawful judgement of his equals or by the law of the land
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to no one will we sell to no one deny or delay right or justice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this clause limits the power of rulers and introduces the idea of lawful process and the idea of a jury
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bbc summarised the main points of the document as
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the origin is in the medieval feudal system in which the king's word was law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it solved at the time a conflict between king john and his main men the barons and bishops
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dispute grew between the barons and bishops and king john over taxes and disputes with the pope
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the barons chose their time to put john under pressure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: john had lost a battle against the french been excommunicated by the pope 1209-1213 and feared civil war at home
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he met the barons at runnymede 20 miles south west of london in june 1215
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the negotiation was managed by john's half brother william longspee and elias of dereham steward to the archbishop of canterbury stephen langton
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the content of the carta was designed to rebalance power between the king and his subjects but especially between john and the barons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when king john set his seal on magna carta he conceded the fundamental principle that even as king he was not above the law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so when king john put his seal to the carta on 15 june 1215 that meant kings would not have as much power as before
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the carta also laid down rules of inheritance and that convictions required some kind of official process
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it stated that people had rights not to be unlawfully imprisoned
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in other words the king is bound to rule within the law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thirteen original copies of the carta were made and distributed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: only four survive today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the four copies are in the british library the bodleian library lincoln castle and salisbury cathedral
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the magna carta was sent out again in 1220 by henry iii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2009 unesco recognized it in its memory of the world register

lines.value: a leap year is a year in which an extra day is added to the gregorian calendar which is used by most of the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while an ordinary year has 365 days a leap year has 366 days
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the extra day february 29 is added to the month of february

lines.value: in an ordinary year february has 28 days but in a leap year it has 29 days

lines.value: the extra day called a leap day is the same day of the week as the first day of the month february 1
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also in a leap year the months of january april and july all start on the same day of the week
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a leap year comes once every four years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this a leap year can always be evenly divided by four
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example 2016 was a leap year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but a year is rather a common year if it can be evenly divided by 100 but not by 400
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is why 1600 2000 and 2400 are leap years but 1700 1800 and 1900 were rather common years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we have leap years because instead of 365 days the earth really takes a few minutes less than 365-1/4 days 365.24219 to go completely around the sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: without leap years the seasons would start one day earlier on the calendar every four years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after 360 years spring in the northern hemisphere and autumn in the southern hemisphere which usually begins on march 21 would begin on december 21 which is when winter in the northern hemisphere and summer in the southern hemisphere presently begins

lines.value: they have leap years when they add an extra lunar month

lines.value: a neural network also called an ann or an artificial neural network is a sort of computer software inspired by biological neurons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: biological brains are capable of solving difficult problems but each neuron is only responsible for solving a very small part of the problem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: similarly a neural network is made up of cells that work together to produce a desired result although each individual cell is only responsible for solving a small part of the problem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is one method for creating artificially intelligent programs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: neural networks are an example of machine learning where a program can change as it learns to solve a problem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a neural network can be trained and improved with each example but the larger the neural network the more examples it needs to perform well often needing millions or billions of examples in the case of deep learning
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two ways to think of a neural network
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: first is like a human brain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: second is like a mathematical equation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a network starts with an input somewhat like a sensory organ
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: information then flows through layers of neurons where each neuron is connected to many other neurons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a particular neuron receives enough stimuli then it sends a message to any other neuron is it connected to through its axon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: similarly an artificial neural network has an input layer of data one or more hidden layers of classifiers and an output layer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each node in each hidden layer is connected to a node in the next layer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a node receives information it sends along some amount of it to the nodes it is connected to
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the amount is determined by a mathematical function called an activation function such as sigmoid or tanh
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thinking of a neural network like a mathematical equation a neural network is simply a list of mathematical operations to be applied to an input
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the input and output of each operation is a tensor or more specifically a vector or matrix
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each pair of layers is connected by a list of weights
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each layer has several tensors stored in it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an individual tensor in a layer is called a node
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each node is connected to some or all of the nodes in the next layer by a weight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each node also has a list of values called biases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the value of each layer is then the out of the activation function of the values of the current layer called x multiplied by the weights
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a cost function is defined for the network
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the loss function tries to estimate how well the neural network is doing at its assigned task
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: finally an optimization technique is applied to minimize the output of the cost function by changing the weights and biases of the network
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this process is called training
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: training is done one small step at a time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after thousands of steps the network is typically able to do its assigned task pretty well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: consider a program that checks whether a person is alive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it checks two things the pulse and breath.if a person has either a pulse or is breathing the program will output alive otherwise it will output dead
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a program that does not learn over time this would be written as a very simple neural network made of just one neuron that solves the same problem will look like this the values of pulse breathing and alive will be either 0 or 1 representing false and true
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus if this neuron is given the values 01 10 or 11 it should output 1 and if it is given 00 it should output 0
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the neuron does this by applying a simple mathematical operation to the input it adds whatever values it has been given together and then adds its own hidden value which is called a bias
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to start with this hidden value is random and we adjust it over time if the neuron is not giving us the desired output
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if we add values such as 11 together we might end up with numbers greater than 1 but we want our output to be between 0 and 1
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to solve this we can apply a function which limits our actual output to 0 or 1 even if the result of the neuron's math was not within the range
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in more complicated neural networks we apply a function such as sigmoid to the neuron so that it's value will be between 0 or 1 such as 0.66 and then we pass on this value to the next neuron all the way until we need our output
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are three ways a neural network can learn supervised learning unsupervised learning and reinforcement learning
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these methods all work by either minimizing or maximizing a cost function but each one is better at certain tasks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: recently a research team from the university of hertfordshire uk used reinforcement learning to make an icub humanoid robot learn to say simple words by babbling
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the lift force lifting force or simply lift is the sum of all the forces on a body that force it to move perpendicular to the direction of flow

lines.value: but there are many other common uses such as propellers on both aircraft and boats rotors on helicopters blades sails on sailboats and wind turbines

lines.value: while the common meaning of the term lift suggests an upwards action lift can be in any direction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for instance for a sail the lift is horizontal and for the wing on a race car the lift is down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are a number of ways of explaining the production of lift some are more complicated than others some have been shown to be false
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the simplest explanation is that the wing deflects air downward and the reaction pushes the wing up

lines.value: yogurt or yoghurt is a milk product made by bacterial fermentation of milk
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the lactose in the milk becomes lactic acid when it is fermented
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lactic acid acts on the protein in the milk to make yoghurt thick and sour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the milk is heated to about 80 °c to kill any bacteria present and to change the milk proteins so that they set together instead of becoming curd
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after it is cooled to about 45 °c the bacteria culture is added and the milk is kept at that temperature for 4 to 7 hours to ferment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soy yoghurt is made from soy milk
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yogurt is one of the oldest produced foods in human history
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: no one knows for sure how long yogurt has been around
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today it is eaten all over the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is rich in protein calcium riboflavin vitamin b 6 and vitamin b 12
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in english the word can be spelled either yogurt or yoghurt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in canada yogourt is also common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be spoken with either a short or a long o
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earliest yogurts were probably made by wild bacteria yeast infections and happened by chance

lines.value: the oldest writings mentioning yogurt were by pliny the elder who said that some people knew how to thicken the milk into something which was sour but tasty

lines.value: stamen grigorov 1878-1945 a bulgarian student of medicine in geneva first examined the bacteria in bulgarian yogurt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1905 he said that it contained a round and a rod like lactic acid producing bacteria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1907 the rod like bacteria was called lactobacillus bulgaricus now lactobacillus delbrueckii subsp
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bulgaricus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the russian nobel laureate biologist ilya ilyich mechnikov from the institut pasteur in paris was influenced by grigorov's work and made a hypothesis that eating yoghurt regularly was the reason why bulgarian peasants lived for so long
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mechnikov believed that lactobacillus was needed for good health and worked to make yoghurt popular through europe

lines.value: yoghurt has a lot of protein calcium riboflavin vitamin b6 and vitamin b12 in it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is healthier than milk is

lines.value: many people who are lactose intolerant can enjoy yoghurt because much of the lactose in the milk has become lactic acid

lines.value: the opposite of civilization is sometimes said to be entropy barbarity rudeness or animal like behavior
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a civilization is generally an advanced stage of organisation

lines.value: that means it has laws culture a regular way of getting food and protecting the people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most civilizations have agriculture and a system of government like monarchs or elections
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they speak a common language and usually have a religion of some kind
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they teach their young the knowledge they need

lines.value: all civilizations since the sumerians and the egyptians have had some kind of writing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because writing lets people store and build up knowledge

lines.value: past societies that would be called more primitive compared to today are still often referred to as civilizations for their time
