lines.value: puberty is what happens in children's bodies that changes them into adults
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after puberty people are able to make children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a girl who has gone through puberty can become pregnant and have a baby
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at puberty a boy's body begins making sperm and he starts to be able to ejaculate which is semen coming out from his penis when he is sexually excited
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if he has sexual intercourse sex with a girl he can make her pregnant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: puberty is started by hormones which are chemicals that tell parts of the body to do things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today on average girls start puberty at age 10 or 11 and boys at age 11 or 12
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however people all over the world start puberty at different ages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: changes that happen to boys and girls during puberty include the sex organs growing bigger hair appearing on the body and growing taller and stronger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these changes are called secondary sex characteristics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people often notice boys voices getting deeper and girls growing breasts and starting to menstruate have periods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because puberty is the time in a child's life when he or she becomes able to make children this is seen as very important
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: therefore people in many countries around the world have different ways of marking this event
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: puberty is started and carried on by different hormones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hormones are chemicals that tell parts of the body to do things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hormones are made by glands in the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: glands are organs special parts of the body that make hormones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is what happens during puberty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on average girls begin puberty at ages 10 11 boys at ages 11 12
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: girls usually complete puberty by ages 15 17 while boys usually complete puberty by ages 16 17
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the major landmark of puberty for females is menarche the onset of menstruation which occurs on average between ages 12 13 for males it is the first ejaculation which occurs on average at age 13
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in rich countries in the 21st century the average age at which children especially girls reach puberty is lower compared to the 19th century when it was 15 for girls and 16 for boys
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can be due to improved nutrition resulting in rapid body growth increased weight and fat deposition or eating meat from animals which have been dosed up with oestrogen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is the general picture but people round the world may start puberty at different ages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because their environment things around them may differ quite a bit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: here are some of the things that make puberty happen at different ages in people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for most boys puberty takes about six years and ends when they are about 17 or 18 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the end of puberty a teenager is usually about 10 to 30 centimetres cm 4 to 12 inches in taller 7 to 29 kilograms kg 15 to 65 pounds lb heavier and stronger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is also able to make a woman pregnant have a baby
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first sign of puberty in boys is that their testicles also called the testes and scrotum the bag that the testicles are in grow bigger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before puberty each testicle is about 1.5 to 2 cm 0.6 to 0.8 in long and has a volume of about 2 to 3 cubic centimetres cc 0.1 to 0.2 cubic inches cu in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about six years after puberty starts the testicles reach their adult size
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the volume of an average adult man's testicle is about 18 to 20 cc 1.1 to 1.2 cu in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it is normal for some men to have testicles smaller than this size and for other men to have larger testicles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the penis also grows bigger during puberty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the start of puberty the average length of the penis is 6 cm 2.4 in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the penis reaches adult size about five years later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a study done in 1996 found the mean length of an adult man's penis is 3.5 in 8.9 cm when it is flaccid (, ) not erect or hard
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the average length of an erect penis is about 12.9 to 15 cm 5.1 to 5.9 in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the testicles have two main jobs to make hormones and sperm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the testicles make the hormone testosterone which spreads around the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this causes the changes in the body that make a boy grow into a man
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: testosterone also makes a man feel like having sex
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one year after puberty begins when boys urinate pee after waking up in the morning some sperm can be found in the urine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a boy is about 13 years old his testicles will have grown to the stage that he may be fertile able to make a woman pregnant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it will be still be difficult for him to do so
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: boys usually only become fully fertile when they reach about 14 to 16 years of age
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sperm in the testicles mixes with other liquids in the body to form a whitish or yellowish and sticky fluid called semen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during puberty two glands in the body called the seminal vesicles and prostate also grow bigger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these glands make a lot of the liquid that is in semen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a man is sexually excited he gets an erection - his penis becomes bigger longer and harder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a male can become sexually excited if thinks about sex or sees a good looking person or if his penis rubs against something
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during puberty some boys also have spontaneous erections
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are erections that happen by themselves without any reason
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can be embarrassing when it happens in a public place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a man's penis is sexually stimulated for some time he has an orgasm and semen shoots out from the penis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called ejaculation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: boys who have not begun puberty cannot ejaculate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a boy's first ejaculation usually happens about one year after he begins puberty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for some boys the first ejaculation takes place when they are sleeping
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called a nocturnal emission or a wet dream
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it happens without the boy's control often when he is having a dream about sex
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: scientists believe that wet dreams are the body's way of removing too much semen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a study done of 5300 white men in the united states in 1948 found that 13% of them had their first ejaculation through a wet dream this seems to tell us that most boys have their first ejaculation after masturbating
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a male masturbates when he rubs his penis to make himself feel good sexually
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the study also found that most boys who have their first ejaculation by masturbating do this a year or more earlier than boys who have their first ejaculation through a wet dream
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a 2004 survey by a magazine in canada found that most males 43% started masturbating when they were about 12 to 13 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a boy begins masturbating wet dreams often stop happening because semen is taken out from his body regularly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a boy starts to ejaculate he usually produces only a small amount of semen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the semen is different from what an adult man produces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is usually clear and stays sticky
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it either has no sperm in it or sperm that do not move properly or do not move at all
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a boy's semen only becomes like an adult man's semen about two years after his first ejaculation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: not long after a boy's testicles and penis start to grow pubic hair (, ) begins to appear
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pubic hair is hair that grows in the pubic region which is the part of the body where the penis is
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pubic hair is shorter curlier and rougher than hair on the head
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it usually starts growing on the abdomen above the penis at the place where it joins the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the abdomen is the part of the torso where the navel or bellybutton is there may also be some hair on the scrotum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after about six months to a year there will be a large triangle of hair in the pubic region
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: within three to four years after puberty begins there is a lot of pubic hair in the area above the penis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later on pubic hair also grows on the abdomen upwards towards the navel and on the insides of the thighs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about two years after pubic hair starts to appear hair also grows on other parts of the body a larger amount of male hormones in the body cause changes to perspiration sweat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this gives it a more adult body odor or smell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hormones also cause sebaceous glands in the skin to make more sebum a type of oil that keeps the skin from getting too dry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sebum and dead skin cells can mix with a type of germ called bacteria and block pores tiny openings in the skin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this causes a skin problem called acne
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most people get acne during puberty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a person has acne he gets swellings on his skin called blackheads whiteheads and pimples
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: blackheads and whiteheads are painless but pimples can be red and painful
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they usually form on the face but can also appear on the neck shoulders upper back and chest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: oil glands on scalp - the part of the head on which hair grows - also make a lot of sebum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can cause dandruff in which small white bits of skin fall from the scalp
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during puberty a boy's larynx or voicebox also grows larger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this makes the laryngeal prominence or adam's apple - the lump that sticks out of the front of his neck - larger too
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the larynx grows the vocal folds become longer and thicker so they vibrate move back and forth more slowly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this causes the voice to lower in pitch or tone and become deeper
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when this happens it is sometimes said that the boy's voice has broken
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it actually does not happen overnight but over some time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during this time the voice may sound scratchy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on average a boy's voice normally reaches its adult sound when he is around 15 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: towards the end of puberty boys go through a growth spurt which lasts for about two to three years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during this time their body grows taller very quickly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the growth spurt is at its fastest point some people grow or more a year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this happens about two years after puberty starts usually between the ages of 13 and 15
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a boy reaches the end of his growth spurt when he is about 18 years old he will be at his adult height
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his body will not grow much taller after that
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of their growth spurt boys muscles can feel sore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these growing pains can feel worse if boys are active and do a lot of exercise
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they go away after a while
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: boys grow more slowly than girls but for a longer time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is why most men are taller than women
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the end of puberty adult males have heavier bones and more muscle than females
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in an average adult man muscle makes up 50% and fat 15% of his weight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on the other hand 40% of an average adult woman's weight is made up of muscle while 27% is made up of fat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because men have less body fat than women their hips do not grow bigger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some bones like those in the jaw and shoulders grow more in males than in females
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is why males have wider faces and shoulders but narrower hips
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the changes in a girl's body during puberty usually take place between the ages of eight and 18 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most girls will have finished puberty around the age of 15
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they will have breasts and pubic hair will menstruate have a period every month and will be able to get pregnant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they will usually also have reached their full adult height
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the breasts start to grow this is normally the first sign of puberty that can be seen on the outside of a girl's body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this usually happens when girls are about the age of 10.5 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a lump that is a bit hard appears in each breast under the areola which is the dark ring around the nipple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the lump in one breast may grow before the other one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called breast budding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: within six to 12 months both breasts will have started growing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the swelling can be felt and seen outside the edges of the areolae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about one and a half to two years after the breasts first start growing they are close to the shape and size of an adult woman's breasts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the nipple and areola may be on a smaller mound on each breast
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this small mound usually goes away when each breast is fully grown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: whether the breasts are small or large depends on how much fat there is in the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between the ages of about eight and 14 on average at 11 or 12 years pubic hair begins to grow along the labia the lips of the vulva usually a few months after the breasts start growing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at first the hair is thin and straight instead of curly and there is not much of it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: within a year the pubic hair becomes rough dark and curly and grows in a triangle shape in the pubic region
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about one year after pubic hair begins appearing underarm hair also grows
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hair on the arms and legs also gets thicker and some girls may have hair appearing on their upper lip and in front of their ears
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like boys higher amounts of hormones in the body cause girls perspiration sweat to change
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this gives them a more adult body odor or smell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hormones also cause the skin to produce more sebum oil which usually leads to acne
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when girls are between eight and 11 years old the two ovaries in their body begin to grow bigger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each ovary is egg shaped and is attached to the side wall of the pelvis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the pelvis is a large set of bones in the hips
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ovaries are organs that make female hormones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these hormones cause a girl to grow into a woman and make her feel like a woman
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hormones also make it possible for females to become pregnant and have babies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: inside the ovaries are about 200000 ova egg cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for a baby to be formed a woman's ovum and a man's sperm must come together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during puberty the ova also grow bigger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between the ages of nine and 15 years on average at 12 to 13 years the vagina and uterus womb become bigger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the uterus is the organ in which a baby grows
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the vagina is a tube leading from the uterus to the outside of the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the opening of the vagina is inside the vulva in between the legs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a clear or whitish fluid may start to flow out of the vagina to keep it clean
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then about two years after the breasts start to grow when a girl is between ten and 16 years old on average at 13 to 14 years hormones made by her ovaries cause the ovaries to release an ovum which moves into the uterus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually only one ovum is released at a time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hormones also tell the uterus to get ready for a baby in case the ovum meets a sperm and gets fertilized
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the walls of the uterus become thicker with extra tissue
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: inside the thick part of the uterus are blood vessels and other nutrients that a baby will need to grow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if an ovum in the uterus gets fertilized it sticks to the wall of the uterus and starts to grow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however if the ovum is not fertilized it does not stick
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the uterus then gets rid of the ovum and the extra tissue by releasing it from the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tissue and blood flows out of the uterus through the vagina
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called menstruation or having a period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bleeding normally lasts for about three to five days though some girls may bleed for longer or have a bit of bleeding between periods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the uterus then starts preparing for another ovum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for most girls the time between their periods is about one month
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for about two years after menstruation starts the time between periods is not always the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some girls may skip a month or have two periods close to each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also normal to have cramps rather painful squeezing feelings or to feel bloated swollen up in the abdomen during periods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when many girls start having periods they begin using sanitary napkins also called sanitary pads or tampons to soak up the blood and tissue
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a sanitary napkin is a piece of material that is absorbent able to take in liquids which is worn between the vulva and underpants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a tampon is a stick of absorbent material that is placed inside the vagina
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2004 a survey by a canadian magazine found that most females 25% started masturbating when they were about 12 to 13 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of more hormones in the body girls start to have more fat in their breasts abdomen hips and thighs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the age of ten years the average girl has 6% more body fat than the average boy but by the end of puberty the difference is nearly 50%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fat makes sure that a baby growing inside a pregnant woman will have enough nutrients
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also the bones in the pelvis move further apart to make room for a larger uterus and ovaries and so there is space for a baby to grow in the uterus and to pass out of the body when it is born
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the extra fat and wider hip bones that girls have give them a curvier shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: girls also experience a growth spurt during puberty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the first year after puberty begins they grow about

lines.value: they grow even faster the next year or so then the growth slows down and almost stops when they start menstruating

lines.value: in mathematics and statistics the mean is another name for the average

lines.value: the mean is calculated by adding all of the values together then dividing by the number of values

lines.value: example 1 2 2 100 100 is a set of numbers or scores

lines.value: if we add all the numbers the answer is 205
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by dividing this number by the number of numbers we discover that the mean is 41
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the difficulty with this particular set of numbers is that no one in this group scored anything like a 41 and the mean does not tell us much about what kind of scores these numbers represent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to find the average of

lines.value: the idea behind the mean is to represent a number of measurements or values by one value only

lines.value: psychiatry is a part of medicine that studies diagnoses and treats mental illnesses and abnormal behaviours and conditions that cause problems and make life difficult for people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the people who practice psychiatry and treat others who have psychiatric problems are called psychiatrists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: psychiatrists are medically qualified doctors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they can legally prescribe medications to their patients to help emotional and behavioral problems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this does not apply to psychologists who are not qualified to prescribe medicines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: psychiatrists learn about how the body and the brain work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: psychiatrists must learn about all kinds of illnesses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes a disease in the body causes the brain to work poorly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cancer in the pancreas causes depression
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: blood sugar problems in diabetes mellitus can cause a bad temper
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are only two examples
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as doctors psychiatrists learn about how medications can help the brain work better
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also learn how medications sometimes cause problems to the brain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes psychologists send their patients to a psychiatrist if the patient seems to have a problem that medicine might help
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the patient should continue to see the psychologist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 1950's the first medicine to help patients with bipolar disorder formally known as manic depressive illness was discovered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was lithium a type of metal in a powder form
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a bit later the first medicine for psychosis was discovered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later medicines to calm people tranquilizers to end depression anti-depressants to help feelings remain the same each day mood stabilizers were discovered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: medicine for mental illness does not cure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the medicines try to get brain chemicals to be the amounts they are in normal people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other medicines slow down how fast the brain works so people with rapid thoughts can be in control of what they think and how they behave
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the medicines are stopped symptoms often come back
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the best known psychiatrist is sigmund freud a medical doctor who was trained in neurology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became certain that hidden thoughts in the brain which he called the unconscious could cause physical symptoms and strange behavior in some people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he believed that human behavior was not all caused by the brain but by things that happened to people when they were babies and young children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his research of this theory - the idea he had - led him to create talking therapy - psychoanalysis - where he tried to figure out what could cause the mind to do things like this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he thought that his figuring things out and telling the patients what had caused the behavior would cure the patient
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unfortunately it usually made no lasting changes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is why psychiatrists and psychologists have gradually figured out many other ways of helping their patients
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since the medications for mental illness were first discovered there have been tools to understand why the mentally ill behave and think in ways that make it not easy for them to live
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: doctors do this by studying the brain as directly as they can
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this field of medicine is called neuropsychiatry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the medical doctors who work in the field are called neuropsychiatrists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they hope someday to really permanently cure or fix mental illness by finding ways to change the brain forever
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the meantime they try to find ways to help by finding better medications
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the science of psychology is studies the way people behave and change
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: psychologists apply this what is found to make new ways of helping people change how they behave
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: talking therapy and applied psychology were the first important ways of helping people with some problems of regular life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some kinds of mental illness can be helped some this way but some kinds cannot be helped
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they need medicines instead then sometimes a psychologist can help the patient a great deal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: controversy has often surrounded psychiatry and the term anti psychiatry was coined by psychiatrist david cooper in 1967
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the anti psychiatry message is that psychiatric treatments may be more damaging than helpful to patients
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: psychiatry's history involves what may now be seen as dangerous treatments e.g electroconvulsive therapy lobotomy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two charismatic psychiatrists who came to personify the movement against psychiatry were rd laing and thomas szasz
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some ex patient groups have become very anti psychiatric often referring to themselves as survivors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: discredited psychiatrists who operated outside the norms of medical ethics include harry bailey donald ewen cameron samuel a cartwright henry cotton and andrei snezhnevsky

lines.value: maccabi haifa football club (, moadon hakaduregel maccabi haifa is an israeli football team from the city of haifa a section of maccabi haifa sports club
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the club has won 11 championships 5 state cups and 3 toto cups
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the club was founded in 1913 and it is one of the country's most successful teams in europe being the first israeli club to qualify for the group stage of the uefa champions league
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: maccabi haifa football club was established in 1913 in the port city of haifa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was a small struggling club that spent most of its time bouncing between the liga leumit and the lower leagues
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the club was overshadowed by their city rivals hapoel haifa who were then the darling club of the city of haifa and especially of then mayor abba hushi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but even in its first years the club adapted a very adventurous and offensive style of play based on technique and short passes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1942 the club reached the israel state cup final but was humiliated 12-1 by beitar tel aviv in the final which is the club's worst defeat ever
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1962 the club won its only honour until the 80s when the team defeated maccabi tel aviv 5-2 in the state cup final
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1963 they reached the final again but failed to defend their title losing to arch rivals hapoel haifa 1-0

lines.value: sir john major born 29 march 1943 kg ch is a british politician who was prime minister of the united kingdom and leader of the conservative party from november 1990 to may 1997

lines.value: he was also a member of the cabinet of margaret thatcher as chief secretary to the treasury 1987-1989 foreign secretary 1989 and chancellor of the exchequer 1989-1990

lines.value: he became a conservative party councillor in 1968

lines.value: after holding several cabinet posts major was elected to succeed margaret thatcher as prime minister and conservative leader
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as prime minister john major oversaw british involvement in the gulf war 1991-92 and his party's narrow reelection in the 1992 general election

lines.value: after this the conservative party became less popular because of the black wednesday fiasco in november 1992 and because the conservative party became divided over the issue of the european union

lines.value: the conservative party was defeated at the 1997 general election and major was succeeded by the labour party's tony blair

lines.value: kinship is the most basic principle of putting individuals into social groups roles and categories
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the basic sort of kinship is to belong to the same family by birth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kinship tells us how we are related to our family or each other through our biology and history
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kinship can be a complex system of social groups
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a universal system as everyone has a family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some small and large scale societies use kinship not only for human reproduction but for economic transactions the political system and [their] religious beliefs j.hendry 1999
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the anthropologist lewis h morgan invented kinship studies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 1850s and 1860s he watched the iroquois a native american group in the northeastern united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was mostly interested in what was keeping societies together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the first to state the different types of kinship systems that exist in his book called systems of consanguinity and affinity of the human family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two main types of kinship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: consanguinity means to be related by blood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: laws in some countries use the amount of consanguinity between two people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for instance deciding who is allowed to be married
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can also be used to decide who can receive property after death if there is no will
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many religions also use the amount of consanguinity to define acceptable practices
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: affinity means to be related by social processes like marriage or adoption
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are also legal and religious definitions for acceptable amounts of affinity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two types of descent involved in kinship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: patrilineal are the relations that come from the father's blood line
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: matrilineal are the relations that come from the mother's blood line
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in economics perfect competition is a type of market form in which there are many companies that sell the same product or service and no one has enough market power to be able to set prices on the product or service without losing business
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the conditions for perfect competition are strict there are only a few markets that are considered to be perfectly competitive and this market form only exists to compare with the other market forms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: generally a perfectly competitive market exists when every firm in the market are price takers and no one is able to charge a different price without losing business
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: specific characteristics of perfect competition includes in the short run a perfectly competitive firm is not productively efficient as the output will not be at where the marginal cost equals to the average cost mc = ac
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however a perfectly competitive firm will be allocatively efficient as the firm will be producing at the profit maximising output where mc = mr which is coincidentally the allocatively efficient point
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the long run a perfectly competitive firm will be both allocatively and productively efficient
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a model can be used to show the perfectly competitive firm's price and output level for a given product
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the diagram shown the cost curves of a perfectly competitive market is shown in its long run equilibrium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for a perfectly competitive firm the marginal cost of producing an extra unit of output is shown using the mc curve in blue whereas the average total cost of producing an extra unit of output is shown using the atc curve in red
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as stated above a perfectly competitive market has a large number of buyers and sellers and the demand does not change with output
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hence the demand curve the average revenue and marginal revenue curves are horizontal in green
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the point in which the demand curve intersects the vertical axis is the price of the product sold by the firm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as firms are assumed to be profit maximising the firm will thus produce at the output level where the marginal cost equals to the marginal revenue mc = mr
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hence the firm will be producing an output of q in the diagram
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the average total cost curve also meets at this point the firm is thus earning normal profits in the long run
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: saint james son of zebedee death 44 ad was one of the disciples learners of jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the son of zebedee and salome and brother of john the evangelist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is called saint james the greater to distinguish mark as different him from the other apostle named james james son of alphaeus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: james is described as one of the first disciples who joined jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the synoptic gospels tell that james and john were with their father by the seashore when jesus called them to begin traveling ( mt.4:21-22 mk.1:19-20
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to mark james and john were called boanerges or the sons of thunder ( 3:17
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: acts of the apostles 12:1-2 records that king herod had james executed by sword ( ac.12:1-2
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was likely the first of the apostles martyred for his faith
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to ancient local tradition on 2 january of the year ad 40 the virgin mary appeared to james on the bank of the ebro river at caesaraugusta while he was preaching the gospel in spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she supposedly appeared upon a pillar nuestra senora del pilar and that pillar is conserved and venerated within the present basilica of our lady of the pillar in zaragoza spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: following that apparition st james returned to judea where he was beheaded by king herod agrippa i in the year 44
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the translation of his relics from judea to galicia in the northwest of iberia was effected in legend by a series of miraculous happenings decapitated in jerusalem with a sword by herod agrippa himself his body was taken up by angels and sailed in a rudderless unattended boat to iria flavia in spain where a massive rock closed around his relics which were later removed to compostela
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 12th-century historia compostellana gives a summary of the legend of st james as it was believed at compostela
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two ideas are central to it first that st james preached the gospel in spain as well as in the holy land second that after his martyrdom at the hands of herod agrippa i his disciples carried his body by sea to spain where they landed at padron on the coast of galicia and took it inland for burial at santiago de compostela
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the authenticity of the sacred relics of compostela was asserted in the bull of pope leo xiii omnipotens deus of 1 november 1884
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tradition at compostela placed the discovery of the relics of the saint in the time of king alfonso ii 791-842 and of bishop theodemir of iria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these traditions were the basis for the pilgrimage route that began to be established in the 9th century and the shrine dedicated to james at santiago de compostela in galicia in spain became the most famous pilgrimage site in the christian world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: st james's way is a tree of routes that cross western europe and arrive at santiago through northern spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eventually james became the patron saint of spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name james in english comes from iacobus jacob in latin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in eastern spain jacobus became jacome or jaime in catalunya it became jaume in western spain it became iago and portugal and galicia it was tiago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: saint james sanctus jacobus became sant iago which was abbreviated to santiago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: james's emblem was the scallop shell or cockle shell and pilgrims to his shrine often wore that symbol on their hats or clothes

lines.value: in mathematical logic and computer science lambda calculus also a-calculus is a formal system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was designed to investigate the definition of functions and how to apply them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also a tool for analysing recursion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was introduced by alonzo church and stephen cole kleene in the 1930s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: church used lambda calculus in 1936 to give a negative answer to the entscheidungsproblem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lambda calculus can be used to define what is a computable function
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: no general algorithm can answer the question of whether two lambda calculus expressions are equivalent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was the first question even before the halting problem for which undecidability could be proved
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lambda calculus has greatly influenced functional programming languages such as lisp ml and haskell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lambda calculus can be called the smallest universal programming language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it consists of just one transformation rule variable substitution and just one way to define a function
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each function definition comes together with a list of the function's parameters i.e variables that can be used inside that definition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: variable substitution means substitution of values for variables that is a transformation step where an application of a function to some arguments is replaced with that function's definition in which all variables that appear in its list of parameters are replaced with arguments used in that application
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lambda calculus is universal in the sense that any computable function can be expressed and evaluated using this formalism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is thus the same as the turing machine formalism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however lambda calculus emphasizes the use of transformation rules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it does not care about the actual machine that implements them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is an approach more related to software than to hardware
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: water is the most common liquid on earth

lines.value: pure water has no smell taste or color

lines.value: lakes oceans and rivers are made of water

lines.value: it may be rain liquid if warm or it may be frozen if cold

lines.value: if water gets very cold below 0 degrees celsius it freezes and becomes ice the frozen variant of water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if water gets very hot above 100 degrees celsius it boils and becomes steam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: water is very important for life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however some studies suggest that by 2025 more than half the people around the world will not have enough water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: water is a fluid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: water is the only chemical substance on earth that exists naturally in three states

lines.value: people know of over 40 about water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike most other liquids such as alcohol or oil when water freezes it expands by about 9%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this expansion can cause pipes to break if the water inside them freezes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: water is a molecule made of 2 hydrogen atoms and 1 oxygen atom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its chemical formula is h 2 o like other liquids water has a surface tension so a little water can make drops on a surface rather than always spreading out to wet the surface
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: things having something to do with water may have hydro or aqua in their name such as hydropower or aquarium from the greek and latin names for water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also called the universal solvent because it dissolves many things

lines.value: plants and animals including ) are mostly water inside and must drink water to live

lines.value: it gives a medium for chemical reactions to take place and is the main part of blood

lines.value: it keeps the body temperature the same by sweating from the skin

lines.value: water helps blood carry nutrients from the stomach to all parts of the body to keep the body alive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: water also helps the blood carry oxygen from the lungs to the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: saliva which helps animals and people digest food is mostly water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: water helps make urine

lines.value: urine helps remove bad chemicals from the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the human body is between 60% and 70% water

lines.value: water is the main component of drinks like milk juice and wine

lines.value: each type of drink also has other things that add flavor or nutrients things like sugar fruit and sometimes alcohol

lines.value: water that a person can drink is called potable water or drinking water

lines.value: the water in oceans is salt water but lakes and rivers usually have unsalted water

lines.value: only about 3% of all the water on earth is fresh water

lines.value: anchors are used to stop boats from moving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today anchors are usually made of metal and they are made to catch the ocean floor the seabed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two main types of anchors temporary and permanent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a permanent anchor is called a mooring block and is not easily moved
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a temporary anchor can be moved and is carried on the boat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when people talk about anchors they are usually thinking about temporary anchors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an anchor works by either weight mass or shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: shape is more important to temporary anchors and design is very important
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: anchors must resist wind and tide and also the up and down movement of waves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oldest anchors were just rocks and many rock anchors have been found from a long time ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many modern moorings still use a large rock as the mooring block
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a simple anchor which uses two arms made of wood and a rock weight is an anchor which is still used today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the wood arms are sharp to enter the seabed and the weight will hold normal movement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the english language uses several special words to describe parts of anchors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because england has a rich marine and naval history and so the language gives a large number of words to boat and ship terminology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a modern temporary anchor usually has a middle bar called the shank attached to a flat surface traditionally called fluke which holds the seabed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the place where the shank meets the fluke is called the crown and the shank is usually fitted with a ring or shackle to attach it to the rode cable chain or rope joining the anchor to the boat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some old anchors have attached to the shank a stock which is a bar that places the anchor in a certain way when it falls on the seabed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: old anchors are often named stocked or stockless anchors depending on whether they have this or not
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many designs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fisherman has a traditional design that has not changed much over time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is less useful than a good modern design and its holding power for its weight is among the worst of all anchor types
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most common type of fluke anchors is the danforth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the danforth style uses a stock at the crown see above to which two large flat flukes are attached
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the stock can rotate so the flukes can move toward the bottom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can hold very well but has difficulty setting entering the seabed on its own
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is efficient for its weight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fluke anchors have difficulty penetrating kelp and weed seabeds as well as very hard sand or clay seabeds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: once set the anchor can come free and fail to reset on its own
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a traditional design the grapnel style is simple to design and build
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a simple hook that is good for rock or reefs

lines.value: it is useless for most other seabeds

lines.value: the archbishop of canterbury is the spiritual leader of the church of england and in the anglican communion the leader of its mother church

lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the office of archbishop of canterbury was founded in the year 597
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in that year saint augustine came to england to the area called kent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had been sent by the pope to convince the local people to become christians

lines.value: augustine became the first bishop in the kingdom of kent and was later recognised as archbishop when a second diocese was created

lines.value: since then there has been an archbishop at canterbury in kent

lines.value: the archbishop of canterbury used to be head of the roman catholic church in england but in the early 16th century the english church broke away from the roman church

lines.value: the new church called itself the church of england and now the archbishop is the leader of that church

lines.value: einstein was born [at ulm] in wurttemberg germany on 14 march 1879

lines.value: his family was jewish but was not very
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however later in life einstein became very interested in his judaism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: einstein did not begin speaking until after age two

lines.value: according to his younger sister maja he had such difficulty with language that those around him feared he would never learn

lines.value: when einstein was around four his father gave him a magnetic compass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he tried hard to understand how the needle could seem to move itself so that it always pointed north
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the needle was in a closed case so clearly nothing like wind could be pushing the needle around and yet it moved
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so in this way einstein became interested in studying science and mathematics

lines.value: his compass him to the world of science

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some believe she may have been born with the disorder called down syndrome but it has never been

lines.value: her very existence only became known to the world in 1986 when a shoe box containing 54 love letters mostly from einstein exchanged between mileva and einstein from late 1897 to september 1903 was discovered by einstein's granddaughter in an attic in california
lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the theory of special relativity was published by einstein in 1905 in a paper called on the electrodynamics of moving bodies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it says that both distance measurements and time measurements change near the speed of light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that as you get closer to the speed of light nearly 300000 kilometres per second lengths appear to get shorter and clocks tick more slowly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: einstein said that special relativity is based on two ideas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first is that the laws of physics are the same for all that are not moving each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all the people on a jet airplane would not be moving much in relation to each other but the people in two different jet airplanes that come toward each other would be moving toward each other very fast
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the people who are all going in the same direction at the same speed are said to be in an inertial frame the second idea is that any observer no matter how fast that observer moves in relation to us is always the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a vacuum is a volume without any matter in it.people who are in the same frame think of them as being in a big box so that they all go places together and at the same speed will measure how long something takes to happen in the same way
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their clocks will keep the same time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but people moving in another frame will look over at them and see that their clocks were moving at a different rate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reason that this happens is actually quite simple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the consequence of two ideas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one idea we have seen already
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: no matter what you are doing even if you are moving toward a distant star at half the speed of light or if you are moving away from it at half the speed of light or any other speed it does not matter if you measure the speed of the light coming from that star it will always be the same number
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the other idea goes against our ordinary ideas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the other idea says that who is standing still and who is moving is whoever you say is standing still or moving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: how can that be?imagine you were all alone in a different universe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that universe has no suns planets or anything else
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it just has you and your spaceship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: are you moving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: are you standing still
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: those questions do not mean anything
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: why
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because when we say we are moving we mean that we can measure our distance from something else at one time and measure the distance at another time and the numbers will not be the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the numbers get bigger we are moving away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the numbers get smaller we are moving closer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: suppose a sailor is standing on the edge of a very long boat with a flat top
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: her boyfriend is standing on the dock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are still very close together so they shout to each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the boat starts to leave
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sailor runs toward the back of the boat at the same speed that the boat moves forward so she and her boyfriend can keep talking
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as far as her boyfriend is concerned she is not moving

lines.value: so to have movement you must have at least two things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we do not think about it because when we sit on the earth in a park which is moving very fast around the sun we think we are not moving because we do not get any closer or farther away from the trees in the park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: now imagine that another spaceship appears in this other universe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on your spaceship you say that their spaceship is coming closer to yours
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after all you do not feel yourself moving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on their spaceship they say that your spaceship is coming closer to theirs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they do not feel themselves to be moving either
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: somebody on an airplane can be moving at several hundred kilometers per hour but they say i am just sitting here let us try to stretch our minds a bit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: imagine that a basketball player is on a glass airplane on the ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people outside can see him very easily
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he begins to walk from the back of the airplane toward the front of the airplane bouncing his basketball as he goes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: maybe the distance between the places where his basketball hits the floor of the airplane is about one meter or one yard
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if some people are under the airplane they can mark the place directly under the airplane where the ball hits the floor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: those marks are a meter or maybe a yard apart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so everybody agrees that the bounces are about a meter or a yard apart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later the plane takes off
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people still watch it from on the ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but this time bounce number 5 is over a place in gibraltar and bounce number 6 is over a place in spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the distance between bounces is measured in kilometers or miles on the ground but the people on the plane get the same answers they did while the plane was on the ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: now suppose some people are on a big spaceship and they want to make a very accurate clock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so they make a long tunnel between decks from what would be like the top of an airplane to what would be the bottom of an airplane
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at one end they put a mirror and at the other end they put a simple machine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it shoots one short burst of light toward the mirror and then waits
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the light hits the mirror and bounces back
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when it hits a light detector on the machine the machine says count = 1 it simultaneously shoots another short burst of light toward the mirror and when that light comes back the machine says count = 2 of course since light is very fast the count changes very fast
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they decide that a certain number of bounces will be defined as a second and they make the machine change the seconds counter every time it has detected that number of bounces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: every time it changes the seconds counter it also flashes a light out through a porthole under the machine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so somebody out taking a space walk will see the light flashing every second
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: every grade school child learns the formula d=rt distance equals rate multiplied by time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we know the speed of light and we can easily measure the distance between the machine and the mirror and multiple that to give the distance the light travels
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so we have both d and r and we can easily calculate t the people on the spaceship compare their new light clock with their various wrist watches and other clocks and they are satisfied that they can measure time well using their new light clock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: now this spaceship happens to be going very fast
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is not coming to earth to visit but it does happen to fly over the north pole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is a science station with a telescope at the north pole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they see a flash from the clock on the space ship and then they see another flash
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: only the flashes do not come a second apart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they come at a slower rate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reason is that the situation is like the basketball player on the airplane
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ball is pushed downward by the player's hand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is the light in the spaceship's machine firing off a burst toward the mirror
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ball hits the floor and bounces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is like the light hitting the mirror and being reflected
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ball returns to the player's hand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is like the light hitting the machine and triggering a new burst of light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: note that the distance between the place on the ground where the basketball is seen to hit the floor and the distance on the ground where the basketball is seen to return to the basketball player's hand is some great distance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: depending on how fast the plane is going it might be a kilometer or even a mile away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so the man on the north pole sees the light flash on the side of the spaceship when it is thousands of miles away and then sees the next flash when the spaceship has gotten thousands of miles closer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the way the north pole man sees it the light started out let's say 100000 miles away and hit its return point when it was perhaps 90000 miles away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so instead of just traveling twice the diameter of the space ship perhaps several hundred meters or yards the light has traveled 10000 miles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: light always goes at the same speed d = rt and so the time this trip took is going to be much greater - as seen by the man on the north pole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is why the clock on the spaceship is not flashing once a second for the earth observer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: special relativity also relates energy with mass in albert einstein's e=mc 2 formula
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: e=mc 2 also called the mass energy equivalence is one of the things that einstein is most famous for
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a famous equation in physics and math that shows what happens when mass changes to energy or energy changes to mass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the e in the equation stands for energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: energy is a number which you give to objects depending on how much they can change other things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for instance a brick hanging over an egg can put enough energy onto the egg to break it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a feather hanging over an egg does not have enough energy to hurt the egg
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are three basic forms of energy potential energy kinetic energy and rest energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two of these forms of energy can be seen in the examples given above and in the example of a pendulum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a cannonball hangs on a rope from an iron ring
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a horse pulls the cannonball to the right side
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the cannonball is released it will move back and forth as diagrammed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it would do that forever except that the movement of the rope in the ring and rubbing in other places causes friction and the friction takes away a little energy all the time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if we ignore the losses due to friction then the energy provided by the horse is given to the cannonball as potential energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has energy because it is up high and can fall down as the cannonball swings down it gains more and more speed so the nearer the bottom it gets the faster it is going and the harder it would hit you if you stood in front of it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then it slows down as its kinetic energy is changed back into potential energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kinetic energy just means the energy something has because it is moving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: potential energy just means the energy something has because it is in some higher position than something else
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when energy moves from one form to another the amount of energy always remains the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it cannot be made or destroyed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this rule is called the conservation law of energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example when you throw a ball the energy is transferred from your hand to the ball as you release it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but the energy that was in your hand and now the energy that is in the ball is the same number
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for a long time people thought that the conservation of energy was all there was to talk about
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when energy transforms into mass the amount of energy does not remain the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when mass transforms into energy the amount of energy also does not remain the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the amount of matter and energy remains the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: energy turns into mass and mass turns into energy in a way that is defined by einstein's equation e = mc 2
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the m in einstein's equation stands for mass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mass is the amount of matter there is in some body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if you knew the number of protons and neutrons in a piece of matter such as a brick then you could calculate its total mass as the sum of the masses of all the protons and of all the neutrons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: electrons are so small that they are almost negligible masses pull on each other and a very large mass such as that of the earth pulls very hard on things nearby
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: you would weigh much more on jupiter than on earth because jupiter is so huge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: you would weigh much less on the moon because it is only about one sixth the mass of earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: weight is related to the mass of the brick or the person and the mass of whatever is pulling it down on a spring scale - which may be smaller than the smallest moon in the solar system or larger than the sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mass not weight can be transformed into energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another way of expressing this idea is to say that matter can be transformed into energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: units of mass are used to measure the amount of matter in something
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mass or the amount of matter in something determines how much energy that thing could be changed into
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: energy can also be transformed into mass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if you were pushing a baby buggy at a slow walk and found it easy to push but pushed it at a fast walk and found it harder to move then you would wonder what was wrong with the baby buggy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then if you tried to run and found that moving the buggy at any faster speed was like pushing against a brick wall you would be very surprised
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the truth is that when something is moved then its mass is increased
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: human beings ordinarily do not notice this increase in mass because at the speed humans ordinarily move the increase in mass in almost nothing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as speeds get closer to the speed of light then the changes in mass become impossible not to notice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the basic experience we all share in daily life is that the harder we push something like a car the faster we can get it going
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but when something we are pushing is already going at some large part of the speed of light we find that it keeps gaining mass so it gets harder and harder to get it going faster
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is impossible to make any mass go at the speed of light because to do so would take infinite energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes a mass will change to energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: common examples of elements that make these changes we call radioactivity are radium and uranium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an atom of uranium can lose an alpha particle the atomic nucleus of helium and become a new element with a lighter nucleus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then that atom will emit two electrons but it will not be stable yet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it will emit a series of alpha particles and electrons until it finally becomes the element pb or what we call lead
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by throwing out all these particles that have mass it has made its own mass smaller
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has also produced energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in most radioactivity the entire mass of something does not get changed to energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in an atomic bomb uranium is transformed into krypton and barium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is a slight difference in the mass of the resulting krypton and barium and the mass of the original uranium but the energy that is released by the change is huge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one way to express this idea is to write einstein's equation as e = m uranium - m krypton and barium ) c 2 the c 2 in the equation stands for the speed of light squared

lines.value: to square something means to multiply it by itself so if you were to square the speed of light it would be 299792458 meters per second times 299792458 meters per second which is approximately 9•10 16 meters 2 )/seconds 2 = 90000000000000000 meters 2 seconds 2 so the energy produced by one kilogram would be e = 1 kg • 90000000000000000 meters 2 seconds 2 e = 90000000000000000 kg meters 2 seconds 2 or e = 90000000000000000 joules or e = 90000 terajoule about 60 terajoules were released by the atomic bomb that exploded over hiroshima

lines.value: light reflecting from a mirror pushes the mirror with a force that can be measured in the case of a photon because its m 0 = 0 then in the case of motionless particles with mass since p = 0 then :e 0 2 = m 0 c 2 ) 2 + 0which is just :e 0 = m 0 c 2 therefore the quantity m 0 " used in einstein's equation is sometimes called the rest mass the 0 reminds us that we are talking about the energy and mass when the speed is 0 this famous mass energy relation formula usually written without the 0"s suggests that mass has a large amount of energy so maybe we could convert some mass to a more useful form of energy
