lines.value: the general theory of relativity was published in 1915 ten years after the special theory of relativity was created
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: einstein's general theory of relativity uses the idea of spacetime
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spacetime is the fact that we have a four dimensional universe having three spatial space dimensions and one temporal time dimension
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: any physical event happens at some place inside these three space dimensions and at some moment in time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the general theory of relativity any mass causes spacetime to curve and any other mass follows these curves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bigger mass causes more curving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was a new way to explain gravitation gravity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: general relativity explains gravitational lensing which is light bending when it comes near a massive object
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this explanation was proven correct during a solar eclipse when the sun's bending of starlight from distant stars could be measured because of the darkness of the eclipse
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: general relativity also set the stage for cosmology theories of the structure of our universe at large distances and over long times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: einstein thought that the universe may curve a little bit in both space and time so that the universe always had existed and always will exist and so that if an object moved through the universe without bumping into anything it would return to its starting place from the other direction after a very long time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he even changed his equations to include a cosmological constant in order to allow a mathematical model of an unchanging universe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the general theory of relativity also allows the universe to spread out grow larger and less dense forever and most scientists think that astronomy has proved that this is what happens
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when einstein realized that good models of the universe were possible even without the cosmological constant he called his use of the cosmological constant his biggest blunder and that constant is often left out of the theory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however many scientists now believe that the cosmological constant is needed to fit in all that we now know about the universe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a popular theory of cosmology is called the big bang
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the big bang theory the universe was formed 15 billion years ago in what is called a gravitational singularity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this singularity was small dense and very hot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to this theory all of the matter that we know today came out of this point
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: einstein himself did not have the idea of a black hole but later scientists used this name for an object in the universe that bends spacetime so much that not even light can escape it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they think that these ultra dense objects are formed when giant stars at least three times the size of our sun die
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this event can follow what is called a supernova
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the formation of black holes may be a major source of gravitational waves so the search for proof of gravitational waves has become an important scientific pursuit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many scientists only care about their work but einstein also spoke and wrote often about politics and world peace
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he liked the ideas of socialism and of having only one government for the whole world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also worked for zionism the effort to try to create the new country of israel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: einstein's family was jewish but einstein never practiced this religion seriously
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he liked the ideas of the jewish philosopher baruch spinoza and also thought that buddhism was a good religion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though einstein thought of many ideas that helped scientists understand the world much better he disagreed with some scientific theories that other scientists liked
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the theory of quantum mechanics discusses things that can happen only with certain probabilities which cannot be predicted with better precision no matter how much information we might have
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this theoretical pursuit is different from statistical mechanics in which einstein did important work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: einstein did not like the part of quantum theory that denied anything more than the probability that something would be found to be true of something when it was actually measured he thought that it should be possible to predict anything if we had the correct theory and enough information
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he once said i do not believe that god plays dice with the universe because einstein helped science so much his name is now used for several different things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a unit used in photochemistry was named for him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is equal to avogadro's number multiplied by the energy of one photon of light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chemical element einsteinium is named after the scientist as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in slang we sometimes call a very smart person an einstein
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most scientists think that einstein's theories of special and general relativity work very well and they use those ideas and formulas in their own work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: einstein could not agree that phenomena in quantum mechanics can happen out of pure chance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he believed that all natural phenomena have explanations that do not include pure chance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he spent much of his later life trying to find a unified field theory that would include his general relativity theory maxwell's theory of electromagnetism and perhaps a better quantum theory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most scientists do not think that he succeeded in that attempt
